review: I LOVE CPK. A while back I saw an article claiming this location has the original menu plus reimagined California cuisine that was suppose to be healthier.  Drinks: We tried both Moscow mule and the blood orange sangria. Both were too sweet for our liking, but overall good if you like your cocktails sweet.  Food: App: white corn guacamole. Pass on this. It was $5 for literally an ice cream scoop size. Nothing special at all.  Wild mushroom cut noodles: flavoring was good but it was missing something. Maybe a dash of truffle oil? Or fresh herbs? I enjoyed it, but just thought it fell a bit flat.  Carne Asada pizza: good. I'll stick to pizza at cpk.  Then why the one star?? Omg the SERVICE was TERRIBLE. We came on a Friday night, an hour before closing. There were some patrons, but not busy by any means. We got our drink order in super fast, and drinks came out almost right away. We had high hopes. Our server walked away without taking our food order, even tho we were def ready ( closed our menu!). Then we waited..and waited..and waited.. even as our server brought the food to the table NEXT to us TWICE, he never looked at us and actually avoided eye contact! We tried to wave other servers down, no one looked at us at all. We finally stopped a BUSBOY who helped us grab another server. Our originally server came by in another maybe 10 minutes?? To tell us he's not sure if our food order made it in to the system, NEVER acknowledging that he didn't even bother to take our order in the first place. There was an awkward moment when he tried to play off the system error as the other server brought our food out.  To make it worse?? I was literally half way through my food, when he walked by and tried to offer dessert menu. Who does that?!? There are two more CPKs in Irvine. Ill continue my visits to those locations and pass on this one, even tho it's down the street from me.

Wow, I used to LOVE CPK....what happened?!  I'm not sure if their quality went down or if its just this location but I am definitely not planning to go back.  First off, this location was lacking in ratings/reviews but I came anyways, mistake #1. We were seated pretty quickly but our server was nowhere to be found.  We sat around waiting and even our host came by and asked if our server had come by yet.  Shortly after, an older man came by to introduce himself as our server.  Since we had to wait so long already, we were ready to order our drinks and our meal.  We decided to share the spinach and artichoke dip and the Garlic Chicken Pizza.   The first thing we got was the Spinach and Artichoke dip....even before we got our drinks.  One water and one Arnold Palmer should not take that long to bring out.  After we had started eating our appetizer, the next thing that came out was our freakin pizza..and STILL no drinks.  I was so appalled that the woman bringing out our food didn't even notice that we had no drinks on our tables at all.  I wasnt even able to tell her the first time she came by with our appetizer because she literally dropped it off at our table and ran away.  So when she brought our pizza out, I asked for our drinks.  She apologized and brought it out shortly after even though she wasn't our designated server for the night. Anyways, on to the food.  The Spinach and Artichoke dip was pleasantly very good and decent in size however the Garlic Chicken Pizza was the most plain and tasteless pizza I have ever eaten.  The pizza was flimsy and lacked toppings.  The chicken was dry and onions were really thinly sliced.  It literally looked like they just threw on some toppings in a hurry.  This "thing" you call a pizza is $13.99?  Wow, what a huge disappointment and waste of money.  I lost my appetite after the first few bites and instantly regretted coming to CPK for dinner. Overall, service was lacking and the quality of the food was lacking as well.  All I know is that I couldve gone to Pieology or Blazed and created my own pizza with unlimited toppings for way less than what I paid for at CPK.  $30 down the drain, I wont be back.

last week we go to the California Pizza Kitchen. That was nice pizza restaurant in Irvine city. We are arrived at lunch time and we have total 6 person. The service was so nice. but it might be lunch time so it is little bit long of witting. The waitress is so nice she very work hard to us. Because this restaurant for pizza so we order 2 kind of pizza one was Hawaii pizza one was BBQ chicken pizza. I prefer BBQ chicken pizza. Because that chicken tastes so good and plus new pizza it was delicious. If I have change next time I will return again.

WARNING _ CHECK YOUR RECEIPTS AGAINST YOUR BILL! I went to CPK Alton/Irvine in September with 2 friends. We split the bill. When I received my credit card bill they had charged my card double the amount on the receipt. One of my friends was charged correctly, the other one was charged about triple. We tried to resolve this with the manager and were told we would get a call back the next morning. We waited 4 days and have still not heard back. I have now contacted their corporate office and am waiting to hear back from them.

Just returned from a lunch with 7 friends and was extremely disappointed with the service. We arrived at 11:30 and there was no crowd and seated right away by a pleasant young man.  After 10 minutes our waiter took our drink order, received drinks after another 10 minutes and didn't return until another 15 minutes to take our order. After a total of 55 minutes only half the food arrived. My ice tea was only refilled once, the salad/soup lunch special was served without dressing nor utensils and 2 of our meals had to be to go since after an hour, 2 in our party had to leave. We're not sure what happened, but this was totally unacceptable and we were extremely upset since we only have the opportunity to have lunch together once a year. There was no apology what so ever.
Marvin is an AMAZING bartender!!! Always makes the best drinks! Will always be a customer because of him

I have been a satisfied customer of CPK for about 2 years.  Most of the time, I have placed take-out/to go orders for pizza.  I have dined-in the restaurant 3-4 times. Each time, the front hostess and waitstaff has been attentive, friendly and professional.  So, 5 stars to the waitstaff. So far, I have ordered the cheese pizza and spaghetti, and nothing else. So this review is for those two meals only.  When I order the cheese pizza, I always request a thin crust, without any basil.  My cheese pizzas have always been hot, filling and delicious.  The crust has been New York style thin - just the way I like the crust.  The cheese has been plentiful and fresh.  So, 5 stars for the cheese pizza.  The spaghetti, although tasty, is too small in size.  So, I am always still hungry and want more to eat. So, 3 stars for the spaghetti (due to the small size portion).

This is one of the few chain restaurants that I like. After all, they're the original when it comes to different pizzas than the usual NY style pepperoni.  Also have had plank salmon and it was really good, as was the Chinese chicken salad. Went here on a recent Saturday nite at 7:45. I miss the failed Mexican restaurant,, El Cholo, that it replaced. So I was anxious to see what this restaurant is doing to try to win in the hard to succeed city of Irvine. From what restaurant owners have told me, they dictate so much in terms of appearance and other things, and nibble the restaurant profits more than the typical town. So how did they do? Months after their grand opening, so far so good. Outside, the parking was surprisingly not too bad.  This mini mall with Ralphs and a bunch of fast food places, stores, etc. can be as bad as any in Irvine, esp. around 6 PM. Inside, it's definitely the best looking of the 10 or CPK's I've been to. Bright and cheery inside, the kitchen, fired oven, and all the madness was in full view. The bar is pretty cool, There is still that cramped feeling as the other CPK's. When we entered, the smiling young hostess opened the door for us.  We were seated near the far window overlooking the patio, not being used because it was nippy outside.  But  driving by in the warm months of early fall, it was pretty full and the wine and laughter flowed freely..  Our waitress was friendly and prompt with getting our order, drinks, and bread. Our food arrived in 20 minutes. But then she disappeared.  I would've wanted a refill on my coke much earlier.And if something was wrong with our food, I would've had to track someone down.  I'm not shy to do that either even asking for the manager.  After all, now that their pizzas are about $15 each, they better get ir right.  The size of the pizzas are big enough so that my friend and I each ate just a half and both saved the other half for the following day.  The pizzas looked and tasted great as usual.  Mine, Thai chicken this time, had a bit more charred bread than usual. But my friend's Margherita, was perfect. I am rarely in the mood to try their desserts listed on the menu, but they do look pretty good. People next to us had the butter cake and said they likes it. Then at 8:15, we noticed that the once crowded restaurant is near empty in our section.  It seems like the Irvine patrons want to prove that much of OC sleeps around 9 PM. At least we didn't hear crickets. We'll be back.

Service: We had to ask for straws twice. Bread was brought out when our appetizer arrived. The server didn't take the glasses even though he brought out refills.  We ended up with five glasses, three were empty, waiting for the server to take them away while we were eating. When I tried to order coffee, he said that there wasn't any that was made.  I don't know why I was told that when it could have been brewed...I just told the server to forget the coffee. Restaurant: It's spacious and pretty inside.  It almost made me do a double take because I couldn't believe it was CPK! Food:  The food was just as good as any other CPK location.  I really enjoy their pastas and dips.  It's great comfort food, especially during the wintertime.  I know that they're known for their pizzas but...that Chicken Tequila Fettuccine though...on fleek every time!   My friend ordered the Jambalaya pasta and asked for double the sauce. The server came back and said that it was going to be $2 extra because of the proteins in the sauce.   He opted out.

Happy hour, Monday through Thursday starting at 8:30pm is a great way to catch up with friends over dinner or small plates and a glass of wine, beer or a cocktail. Ronnie and Marvin at the bar are outstanding, and management is just as good. Always friendly, fun and easy going.
Good Food, Adequate Lunch portions with good service. We were in and out quick with our tummys satisfied
Staff: Friendly! Excellent service AND  Amazing service from our server ALEXIS ,,The food and appetizers we ordered, were really good. and Will definitely be coming back here again!

We ordered takeout. The penne pasta that we got was very dry and lacked any flavor. The bread was hard and stale it felt. The pizza was very dry. I felt the food was very rushed and made the whole takeout experience horrendous.

Crazy right. 5 Stars to a chain restaurant???  This is a newer CPK restaurant. More modern inside with a new menu. I had the Cedar Plank Salmon that they cook in the wood burning oven which is excellent. The only thing that a high $$$$ seafood restaurant could do different  to the salmon is to raise the price another $15 and give you a cloth napkin. They have pizza, pasta dishes, salads, beer and wine. Great family place or sit at the dinner bar.

Comment is on service - management needs to speak to the 12 year old/teenagers that work here and explain the concept of customer service to them. No one needs attitude and rolling eyes and childish behavior with their meal. Won't be back.

The renovation is absolutely stunning and the earthy, green vibe is felt throughout their menu and attention to detail. CPK is not what you think it is. They've changed...for the better in my opinion.  Met up with a few friends after work to have dinner and a few drinks to help the week pass by a little faster. Everyone needs that mid-week pick me up, right? We were seated in a booth and our server was quick to take our orders, but also give us plenty of time to look over the menu.  We started with drinks - California Crush, Red Sangria and White Sangria. Our server, Mario, was very helpful through suggestions and helped us narrow down our options. We had so many questions (mostly just being indecisive on which one is better) and he answered with a smile through them all.  For food, we decided to start with white corn guacamole & chips. For our dinner, our table got the Brussels & Bacon (well-done) flatbread sans the carmelized onions, Asparagus & Arugula Salad, Mushroom & Spinach flatbread, and Penne Pasta with chicken. Mario came by to check on us every so often, making sure our satisfaction levels were over the moon, pretty much.  To end the evening, we got the salted caramel pudding. After 10 minutes of conversation at the table, the dessert never made an appearance. Mario came by to check on us and personally made sure the dessert was brought right out. To apologize for the long wait, he comp'd it, which took us by surprise. Service is surely on another level since the new renovations. I like! Since one friend had to leave for the evening, the two of us stuck around for another round of drinks at the bar. To our delight, late night happy hour was just about to start! We ordered the Agave margarita (recommended by bartender as the best) and California Roots (super refreshing cocktail with avocado).  Although the weeknight was pretty crazy, it began to slow down by around 9:30 and we got to chat it up with the bartenders about whiskey, bourbon and best things on the menu. Somehow, we got around to decorating a few people's name tags, lol! Thanks for putting up with us barside, Ronnie and Thomas. With the new changes, you're in great hands all around. I'm really digging this spot! I'll be back soon :)

I stopped at this CPK for lunch a week after attending a Yelp event here. I will just be reviewing my lunch but will give a few extra recommendations based on the event in my last paragraph. This location is one of the first "reimagined" CPKs that has new decor and menus which will slowly be rolled out to all locations. Arriving solo, the hostess pushed me to sit at their "pizza bar" - a counter that faces the prep and pizza-making area. I found this space to be a bit claustrophobic and made me feel uneasy as you constantly have people prepping pizza toppings or actually making pizzas two feet in front of you; I felt like I was being stared at the entire meal. My advice, if you are dining alone, is to not sit here and insist on a table. It might be fun for a kid but otherwise - no. I ordered off the lunch menu: a half-sandwich and salad duo. The sandwich I chose was the roasted turkey and brie on ciabatta. Spinach-quinoa was the salad I picked. Initially they brought me some fresh-out-of-the-oven-one-minute-ago bread which was heavenly. My platter with both salad and sandwich arrived soon after. The salad was very good but requires a knife to cut the large spinach leaves unless you don't mind them flopping all over your chin on the way into your mouth. The salad, aside from the fresh spinach which was sprinkled with quinoa, consisted of crisp Granny Smith apple pieces, marinated cranberries and spiced pecans with a vinaigrette on the side. The flavors seemed to hit every taste bud note - it awakened the tongue and was a pleasure to eat. The sandwich was very good although my first bite was quite bitter thanks to one of the greens which I quickly removed. Turkey and warm brie with bits of pear is a great flavor combination yet it seemed to be missing something. Maybe the honey mustard needed a stronger flavor. I ordered a slice of key lime pie to finish things off. The graham cracker crust was perfect and the key lime was flavorful yet not too strong. Yum-O-Rama. Service was excellent. I was checked up on often and he made fun yet brief conversation every now and then which made the meal all the more enjoyable. As previously mentioned I attended a yelp event here the previous week and can confidently also recommend the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza, the grilled ribeye (seriously, CPK now makes a fantastic steak!) and the salted caramel pudding. From the bar I recommend the sangria.

The last time I went here the pizza wasn't that good. The bbq chicken pizza was abit soggy and not crisp at all.   I tried the works pizza too.. and that too was soggy. If I wanted pizza I'd rather just go to round table pizza, Mod pizza, or Pieology.

Loved my evening at my local CPK. Had the Sicilian this n crust pizza and the ribeye steak. Our server Frankie was very pleasant. Made excellent drink recommendations. Try the sangria flight. They're all so refreshing and fruity. Then for dessert we had the butter cake. It's bomb .com to the max for sho. Will definitely be back.

The food is good enough and typical of CPK. This review is about the bad service, which has been consistently bad since the place opened. My party of four was seated in the bar area. First we were greeted by a passive aggressive waiter who told us we were the first table all night to say "please." When we commiserated his response was, "that's Irvine." Uh, we live in Irvine, so thanks?  Then Marvin, another waiter, comes to take our order. Poor Marvin. This is just not the job for him. He's worked there since the place opened and just doesn't improve. Last night he completely forgot to submit our order. It wasn't crowded when we were there. How do you take a group's order and then completely forget to enter it? Waiter number one comes by and we tell him we haven't gotten our food. He says "Marvin must have spaced out" then brings us a free appetizer and promises free dessert. We don't want dessert, we just want what we ordered. Then Marvin comes by and awkwardly sucks up to us. An apology is nice, but the continued "I'm sorry, miss" is just uncomfortable and unnecessary. Like I said, he's just not good at this. Sucking up does not equate to good service. Then Marvin and passive aggressive waiter number one continue hovering over us, offering free food, and passive aggressively asking if they can help when we are reviewing the bill.  How about this: Don't insult Irvine, provide friendly, unobtrusive service, and provide the basics like submitting a table's order on time. You don't need to be fake nice and offer free food to get a tip, and these things don't make up for bad service.

Team Alton Square is Amazinggg!! They made my friend and I feel right at home. Our server Mike O. Was so full of life! Isabel was the sweetest, thank you for everything! And the manager with the beautiful beard (didn't get his name) was so welcoming. Team Alton Square... proud of you ;)
CPK has really updated their entire menu and look. Very cool decor at this location. Looks like a modern bar. Check out the bike frame chandelier.

I love CPK, I am a fan of there Spicy chipotle chicken pizza. Recently I discovered one more amazing item on there menu Jambalaya pasta which is delicious, spicy and tangy.  Also, the staff is friendly, service is quick what else do you want on a weekend.  For desert I would recommend the butter cake with ice-cream.

Called to take an order to go. I was informed that they closed at 10pm, your Yelp hours state 11pm. If you cannot accurately update your Yelp hours, you deserve this Yelp review.   If your employees were lying in order to not make an order to go at 10:35pm, then this location and management deserve this review.  Pick another restaurant, one that cares about customer service.

I came here for my online order even though the one at the spectrum is a lot closer. I just didn't want to deal with the parking. Well now after my experience, I would have rather dealt w/ the parking than this unorganized experience. Poor guy at the take out counter was stressed out and could have obviously used an extra hand. To management- lunch rush should really have two people actively working to make this as smooth as possible. Nope not coming here again order. It it wasn't for the fundraiser to help Las Vegas families I would have straight up cancelled my order.. sigh

The food was good but the service was non-existent. This was a Sunday at noon - there were not many people in the restaurant, but obviously not enough staff. Our waitress was friendly but didn't bring our food or check up on us at all. We waited an extremely long time for our drinks and when we tried to get drink refills, we were never able to. Not sure I would ever go back here.

Ordered food from here and specially mentioned several times that I am allergic to BACON!  I picked up my salad and pizza, guess what was on it?  Yes Bacon!!  I called back after getting home with the food and didn't even get an apology until I made an online complaint and then Kevin the supervisor/manager called me and told me he was going to give me a refund, it's been 3months and I have got any refund! Crappy food and horrible management

I dropped in around 3:30 for a late lunch after a rough day.  LOVED my usual shrimp scampi zucchini -- for this dish alone, I can't quit CPK.   However, the strawberry shortcake should be avoided (it's true I ate most of it but listen I was super hungry after a crap day) -- the whip cream tasted canned, the strawberries were kinda soggy, and the biggest crime of all - I don't think the biscuit was fresh. It would have been amazing if they had given me a fresh biscuit - bc it had serious potential in deliciality. Lastly, the wine - of course I ordered wine after a crap day: it was a New Zealand sauvignon blanc and it was okay BUT what I didn't appreciate is that if I order "a glass", I don't want to be given and charged for the 9oz versus the 6oz.  At the time I didn't realize so of course I drank it. I needed it! And of course I paid for it. BUT I didn't order it and no one asked if I wanted to "supersize" it.  I'll go back to CPK again, by myself, with the family, etc; BUT, I don't like having to check that they get my order right. Especially when I was the nearly the only person on my side of the restaurant!

I met two friends for lunch here last week.  I ordered the lunch-sized BBQ chicken pizza, along with a sparkling water and a Caesar salad. Our lunch was served exactly as ordered, in a timely manner; I appreciate the fact that the hostess greeted us when we arrived too :-) Overall, the atmosphere was pleasant, the food was good, and the bathrooms were clean - thumbs up!

This location is always busy and packed! My coworker and I left work early to get there around 5:30pm. Wait was about 5-10 minutes.  Food: Margherita pizza - Simple yet delicious. Ingredients were good and thin crust was light but flavorful. Caesar salad - We split a full Caesar salad which was a good portion size. If you prefer less dressing, I recommend asking it on the side. I felt the salad a bit more dressing which made it soggy. Butter Cake a la mode - our favorite dish of the night! Similar to Mastro's butter cake. Moist, buttery goodness perfect with vanilla ice cream and sugar crumbles. It's probably made of pure butter but it is truly decadent! Drinks: Mojito - very refreshing, not too sweet, on the stronger side. Moscow mule - gingery, strong, loved it! Blood orange sangria - way way too sweet! I had them re-make it and it was still way too sweet! Tasted like pure simple syrup. Would not recommend. Overall, food was good. It was just the service that really brought down the stars. Service was excruciatingly slow. We had to flag our server several times and it took ages to get our check. We would not return just due to the lack of service and attentiveness we could've gotten elsewhere.
Great food and the customer service was amazing!! Also the managers were very visible and both acknowledge the table during lunch hour!!

Worst. Not valued. Won't be back. If you eat here I recommend you come minimum 2-3 hours before closing. My family and I showed up an hour and a half before closing and were rushed with little service. The staff also attempted to guilt us into rushing. The food was terrible, the service was terrible. Will not be back. In fairness to them the manager was very kind and tried his best to help us.

I've only come here for their curbside pick up but I love their customer service! Everyone I've talked to or interacted with here has been super nice & helpful. I could go on for days about the chicken tequila pasta-it's heavenly. I'm vegetarian so I get it without the chicken & just add more veggies and I'm happy that they let me make altercations like that! Other places usually get annoyed.  I also love that they give me bread even when it's a to go order LOL cpk bread is amazing!!

Great CPK! The manager is very approachable and friendly. He gave us a free appetizer on our visit. He was very attentive as well as our server. Even better, all of the other servers were kind and helpful as well!! The food was wonderful, but it's the service that makes us want to come back to this location ! Thank you!!

This is a California Pizza Kitchen. It is across from the CVS. There was a lot of unoccupied seating at the time. Because there was a lot of unoccupied seating there was little delay in getting menus and ordering. They were very nice, and we were able to occupy a larger table for a smaller party, so more seats for our purses. Excellent. The location is a PokéStop so we managed to refill items while eating and waiting for the payment to be processed. The quantity of food in the dishes we ordered seemed to be insufficient to fill us but it tasted good. The restrooms are very good and the sink has a neat design.

I'm commenting on service, not food. Food is okay. I ordered a fettuccine with mushroom and shrimp added to it. However I was being charged for double shrimp. No doubt that it came with a lot of shrimp, it's more like half dish of shrimp. However, I really didn't recall that the server double check with me that I made that weird order, mushroom with double shrimp. When I looked at the bill, she confirmed that she checked with the chef that they did put double shrimp, again, I agree, it's half dish of shrimp and I ate that. So I did pay for double shrimp, I think I should eat what I pay for. But come on, $25 for a plate like that in CPK? I think it's insane.  What I am complaining here is the server should double check with customers for unusual order like that.

This location is so big and more modern than any one I've ever been to!  I came there at 915 when closing was at 10 so not many people where there so I expected the service to be a little faster but that was alright.  I got the Thai crunch salad, pear and gorgonzola pizza, and the chicken lime fettuccine. All delicious!! I had a $10 off $40 purchase on my rewards app so the meal was super cheap, plus I had tons of leftovers.

I had not been to CPK for many years.  This location was new, maybe only a year old.  Service was reasonable attentive.  We had ordered classic BBQ chicken pizza with added pinapple but they mess up and give me bacon instead of pinapple.  However, I was offered the bacon pizza for free while I was waiting for the pinapple pizza.  Add one star for this.  We also had a tequila chicken pasta which had good flavor but the portion was small and had very few chicken.  I had a mahi mahi taco with chips which was good.  At last we had a pumkin cheese cake which was good.  The decor was comtemporary.  Overall an upscale place with an upscale price.  I took advantage of Explore OC from Irvine Company.

CPK is a classic, I have been going here my entire life.  This very popular chain has locations all over not only Southern California but world wide.  I actually have been to a CPK in China once! My favorite appetizer is the buffalo cauliflower! It's amazing how much they taste like buffalo wings! The sauce is great and the cauliflower has a nice crunch. For my meal I always go for the barbecue chicken salad or the tequila chicken pasta.  They are both classics! I also don't like the pasta that comes with the tequila chicken, so I always swap the noodles for angle hair or spagetti.  The atmosphere is at this specific location is very relaxed with trendy decor.  They have this awesome art piece of a bunch of bicycles which I really like.  Our server was very friendly, and forgiving, when I accidentally spilt my entire water all over the floor.

I would really like to give 4.5 stars but only because they took off one of my favorite desserts. The Tiramisu! We would sometimes go there just for that.  Anyway, it is still one if my favorite places. The staff is friendly and the food is always delicious.

The NEW CPK has some potential with its new style, concept, and menu. Usually see lots of people coming to check out this new spot.  DÉCOR:  - Updated urban style with seating area in dining room, homey living space, bar counters, and outdoor patio (good for mixer or happy hour) - Indoor waiting area has some comfy couches by the wine refrigerator, and there are a few cozy couches in the outdoor area. One family brought board games for their little ones to play while they waited to be seated. Genius!  SERVICE: okay considering the first month of opening. Put your name and mobile number down with the hostess, and CPK will text you when the table is ready. The wait is going to be longer than anticipated. We estimated 20 min wait and became a 40-45 min wait before we were seated. Server did check in on how we're doing. FOOD: This new CPK has a variety of items including appetizers, salads/soup, main plates (rib-eye, salmon, chicken, etc), pastas, signature pizzas, drinks, wine, and cocktail. There's also gluten free and vegan menu too. GARLIC CREAM FETTUCINE WITH CHICKEN ($14.99): small serving size, but it was too rich and heavy for me. After one bite, I didn't want to continue eating. Could be it was served lukewarm and didn't taste fresh at all. WILD MUSHROOM PIZZA WITH TRUFFLE OIL ($14.99): I've had it when it was fresh off the oven on opening night, which was DELICIOUS! But, when it was served last night, it was a pure disappointment.  You can tell even before eating that it's been sitting out for a while and the bottom of the crust was soggy. No bueno on the consistency of food. Also the truffle oil given was so few :( MUSHROOM PEPPERONI SAUSAGE PIZZA ($14.29): Cremini mushroom, pepperoni, spicy Italian sausage, basil, mozzarella, and wild Greek oregano: okay, but a bit too salty FIRE-GRILLED RIBEYE ($25.99): grilled with Pinot Noir sea salt and topped with creamy bleu cheese butter served over roasted potatoes and lemon-garlic wild arugula salad: rib-eye was juicy and tender~ PESTO CREAM PASTA WITH CHICKEN ($14.69): yummy penne with sundried tomatoes and basil pesto cream CALIFORNIA ROOTS: vodka, fresh avocado & mint, fresh agave sour, fennel salt rim  - CPK's newest drink tastes too herby and grassy, not a fan Overall service was okay, but food could be good if it were served hot, which presents an issue of consistency. Also it's very loud and noisy in the dining area, which makes conversation a little difficult.If they can resolve the parking and food consistency issue, this could be the new neighborhood restaurant. TIP:  1. For birthday celebration, they provide complimentary ice cream. 2. Parking may be an issue here: if you circle around a few times, you'll find it or go towards the back of CVS for additional parking.

I came here on grand opening night, Wednesday August 26, 2015. The restaurant was packed and bustling and there was simultaneously a private Yelp event going on. This could have been disastrous, but it wasn't! Service from each and every server I encountered was fantastic. I used to be in restaurant management, so I a bit skeptical about how successful 2 major events would be in one night, but I was blown away. More than successful! Each cocktail I had was delicious and each entrée I tried was fabulous.  If you want a creative drink, you have to try the California Roots. It's made with fresh avocado and rimmed with fennel salt. Not too sweet and quite delicious. This might well become my new favorite cocktail. The blood orange sangria was also very good, but it's on the sweeter side. It would be a perfect drink for a novice.  Now, let's move onto the Fire-grilled ribeye. I had my doubts about a pizza focused restaurant making good ribeye. Well, let me say, I was completely wrong. Order it medium rare. There's also herb butter melting on top when it's served. Gorgonzola butter would have given me a heart attack! The ribeye was so good. This is definitely be my new go to dish here. The salted caramel pudding for dessert was also good. Crumbly bits at the bottom. There wasn't am overpowering caramel flavor. It was a nice, mild dessert perfect to share, or even for kids.  The hustle and bustle made me miss the industry. I was lucky enough to chat with the regional territory manager and a few PR ladies. Everyone was friendly and informative. Way to go CPK, I was impressed!
I always have their jamaican jerk chicken pizza. It's the best. That's all I ever order and always been happy with it at every location.

It's been a while since I've eaten at CPK (in my opinion, they used to be good, but have gone downhill). I came here for a team work lunch, and I guess this is a new concept CPK. I ordered the half Thai Chicken Lettuce, which I was expecting to come out as lettuce wraps, as they used to make it. It came out to be an actual salad, with fried wontons and everything, and barely any chicken. I also ordered the crispy mac n cheese, which was disappointing as well. It tasted old and cold, so I just scraped off the insides. The service was good, although they did take a long time getting our check and birthday ice cream for my coworker. +Service: Good, but not the best. It got slower the longer we stayed, but that was also during rush lunch hour as well. -Food & Price: It could have been what I ordered, but I think their food could have been better. Even though what I ordered was a half order and was large, it barely had any chicken so I can't justify the price for it. If I come back, I might try the rib-eye, or pizza, but I don't think I will be anytime soon.

Came in toning with my fokes the server I had Isabel was not good at all we ordered a few things she never clear a signal plate or cup from our table even tough the table was overflowing with things we had evrything just sitting on our table  and she never reeled our water or drinks she seed to just ignore  us we probly will not retun

Great dinner. Great service. Alejandro is our server. He is so on top of it!  Our drinks never got below half before we had a refill. The food was out in record time. We sat on the patio on a beautiful Sunday evening. Definitely will be back. I love this re-imagined restaurant. It used to be a Mexican restaurant for a very long time and it is now a CPK which was a great improvement. So happy to have a CPK closer to where we live!

I'm writing this review right after ordering. We haven't had our food YET! Laura who is our server she totally got our taste. She's very friendly and nice. I'll definitely be a regular of this restaurant because of her. Thank you again for your best service Laura!

To be honest I come in to this restaurant about once a week. I am totally hooked on their salads. I get the best service in town from the bartender Stephen.   Thank you for a couple years of great service and free desserts.

This is my first time placing a catering order at this CPK Location. I am beyond impressed and highly satisfied with the customer service we at 4Ever Young Living have received from Robert, Monique, and the General Manager , Sam.  I placed my catering order the night before at around 7pm for a next day pick up at 11:15am. When calling the stores number I dialed #1. Tip I received from Robert... dial #2 to speak directly to the stores representatives. Dialing 1 will lead you to the call center, which late has been completely all over the place. My order did not come to the store in time for my promised 11:15am pick up. It was listed at 11:45am, but our lunch meeting was scheduled for 12pm. They made it happen and we were able to pick everything up in time! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! CPK is perfect for catering! I highly RECOMMEND THAT YOU ORDER THE TRIO. The small feeds about 8-10, but it was enough to feed a doctors office of 12. Hey offer vegetarian friendly and gluten free alternatives. Thanks again!

Anyone else experience bad service from one of the waiters, and even from the assistant manager?  Already contacted the general manager so wont mention names.  The experience was very confrontational. Shocked that CPK would allow this.

Worst service ever!!! Asked to place a to go order and refused to take my order because I was a minute late after "their" time after they kept me on hold for 5 minutes. Then we go to place the order in person they didn't want to serve us or take our order and they don't close until 10, mind you it was barely 9:45. They gave us attitude, they didn't want to take our order making us practically beg them too please make our food. We asked for bread on the side which always comes with the order they told us they wouldn't make anymore for us which is supposed to come with our meal. Second time dealing with awful customer service and NEVER coming back here again. The worst part was after going through all this trouble our food was cold, didn't taste well and was poorly made because they just wanted to rush home. The manager was unhelpful and rude also, don't come here go to the one in TUSTIN where there's great service and they make the food well also. WORST SERVICE EVER!

LOVE for CPK! Especially this location. This is by far the coolest CPK i've ever been to.  To start off, the food is always consistent. I am a big fan of The Works pizza and every time it just gets more mouth watering and satisfying. It is ALWAYS ON POINT! The restaurant itself has a nice California vibe, clean and full of real local photos. The staff was very friendly. I brought a group of 12 work colleagues and they were able to have us seated in less than 10 minutes during the lunch hour. (I did call about 30 minutes before to let them know. They accidentally gave our table away to another group of 12 that kind of stole our table, but no worries. Honest mistake. CPK rocked it and got us taken care of.) I'll definitely recommend this location to anyone. Great service, awesome food and cool atmosphere.

Went last night for Veterans Day with my mom and sister.  I usually go to the one in tustin but this one was closer to where I lived so I decided to give it a try.  I sat down and our waitress walks up and I ask for a veterans menu and she replies with "thats only for veterans" so my  reply is I am a veteran and show her my id. And she walks away and gets me a menu no apology or a thank you for your service.  Ok so maybe she didn't mean it in a bad way by it sure some off that way here are a few responses she could have used instead.  "Oh are you a veteran"  "Sure I can get you a menu can I see your id" Another annoying part of the night is that a customer and his girlfriend sat down and he asked for a menu and she said no problem thank you for your service. I was a bit frustrated how the same waitress had two totally different responses even though we were both veterans asking for the same thing a menu.  one good thing about my night was a manager he was so sweet he came and shook every veterans hand and gave us a little thank you card he seemed very genuine.  There was another manger who was a blonde female who came and dropped of our pizza but said they made it wrong and that today was my lucky day and they were going to make another pizza this time the correct way at no charge but she bypassed us about five times and never brought our other pizza. After 30 minutes of waiting we decided to leave.  I may come back only for the nice manger I wish knew his name but I highly doubt it.  Food was good and so was my sangria and that salad was delicious. The food was what made me give them 3 stars.

Always good and always friendly service. I had stopped going to CPK, but it is vastly improved. Love their menu and the healthier options. It is s nice neighborhood place, as well as somewhere nice to take guests  and family

Good not great. We had to wait about 10 min for someone to come to the counter to greet and seat us ( only about three other people were in there). Another 15 minutes for the waitress to come by our table and take our order and drinks. Finally got our food, pizza was good pasta was a bit undercooked. Would choose the spectrum over this one.

Standard CPK food. I had the cedar smoked salmon. It was great and probably my favorite dish at CPK. Salmon was cooked just right and had good flavor. I did get to try other entrees like garlic chicken and mahi mahi tacos, loved it. I tried the chicken lettuce wraps and I felt like there were a lot of mushrooms and very less chicken. Even the Hearth Roasted Halibut was great. Loved the mango strawberry cooler too. Overall a great experience and quantity of food.

What a beautiful restaurant ,I ordered the garlic chicken my wife ordered Moroccan salad both were out of this world .Let's talk about service our waitress was attentive and kind she had many suggestions as there menu has many selections not just pizza lastly the manager Sam made us feel right at home like there was no one more important than us ...very refreshing thanks CPK
Order the "Sicilian" pizza on thin-wheat crust...The best! Staff is awesome. They greet you at door and keep you cups full.
The food is very good. The menu includes much more than just pizza, but it is too expensive for the portions. Individual Pizza's  range in price from $13 to $17.

Came into this location with my wife in January. Ordered the white corn avocado dip.  There was something in the dip that broke a tooth in half! I talked with the GM and he talked to corporate to get ahold of me.  It's now march 2nd and I still am in the dark.  I will never give CPK my business ever again.

I know in my first review I vowed to never come back to CPK but things have changed! LOL! My sister started bringing us food from here and I must say it is on point!  We love the small plates, I especially love the Mac & Cheese bites! These are crack! I could easily eat 2 orders of them! I dip them in ranch and marinara sauce (yes I know I'm weird) They aren't oily and greasy at all, they are crispy and delicious! Of course you can't go wrong with their pizzas,  I prefer sausage & pepperoni on mines but we tried a 3 cheese pizza with pepperoni, it was delicious! I also enjoy their pastas, the Bolgenese is delicious! My sister tells me they also have Alfredo pasta which is my favorite!! I definitely have to try that next!!  Their seasonal desserts and non-alcoholic drinks always look amazing! We always do take out so I can't comment on the service but one time we were picking up our food and they were out of bread already! It was only 7PM! No I did not want to wait the extra 15 minutes either LOL Even though I've moved out of Irvine this location will always be my go to, when I like a certain location I stick to it! Not to mention it gives me a reason to come visit my sister! LOL ^____^

last time i went to cpk was when n*sync and britney spears were at the height of their career.  so you see, it's been a while. upon entering cpk we were pleased with the decor and ambiance.  business was pretty good considering a weekday night. our experience with the pizza?  we basically could've bought a frozen pizza from ralph's and baked it ourselves.  low quality pizzas that comes with a $16+ price tag.  nope.  plenty of build your own pizza places in town that can execute pizzas better than cpk. so what's the differentiation between store bought cpk and visiting the restaurant?  you get shitty service with shitty pizza.  our server was not attentive.  within our vicinity of tables, there were 4 different servers serving our area, just didn't seem efficient at all.  our server was out of sight most of the time, and tables near us definitely got better service than we did. so next time you're considering visiting cpk?  i suggest you either bake some store bought cpk pizza at home, or go to another pizza restaurant.

I ordered a takeaway of 2 pizzas at 5.30pm when they'd just opened. They told me it would take 15 mins but actually took 40 mins!  I tried the Jamaican pizza and Thai chicken pizza. Both were ok but the Thai chicken was slightly better.

This USED to be my favorite CPK. Used to be... I loved the new updated trendy decor which makes you feel like you're eating at a trendy American New restaurant, while still being able to enjoy the good reliable CPK fare that I like.  When this location first opened, the food was good. They had new things on the menu that I hadn't seen at other CPKs. I thought that this was one of the nuances of the new location. Haha...I hadn't realized that the entire chain was rolling out these non-pizza items.  My family likes the shrimp & chicken lettuce wraps, lemongrass chicken, cedarplank chicken, and the grilled rib-eye, which have been really good. Yes, yes...we get pizzas & salads too, but different strokes for different folks.  HOWEVER!!!!! Recently, the food has been consistently BAD!!! Always overcooked!! Ugh!! On the last visit, I got my lemongrass chicken per usual, but it was sooooo dry and overcooked. The sauce was also very thick, like it had been sitting in the saucepan for way too long and thickened.  I kindly let my server know about my disappointment and she promptly alerted the manager & had the kitchen re-fire the entree. This dish is usually my favorite. The portion is generous so I always take half for my lunch the next day. By the time I got my food, I got full from picking off the plates of my dear family members. Unfortunately, the chicken was still dry. I packed it up for lunch the next day. When I attempted to eat the left-overs for lunch, I kept on sensing a strange grit between my teeth. When I cut into layers of the bok choy, it was completely dusted with dirt. It had NOT been cleaned properly. See picture. The food was completely inedible. Had to throw it out!!! Needless to say, I won't be ordering any non-pizza items or visiting this location for a while. BLECH!! So disappointed!!
Good service from a gentleman who was new. He was very quick and did a great job recommending items on the menu. The Boneless Ribs with Mac n Cheese was great! Worth it!

Decided to give this location another shot and while I still don't care for the main dining room I really like it for Happy Hour (having returned twice in a short time)! During my 2 recent visits, it's been refreshingly peaceful (at 3 o'clock), allowing for nice, relaxed conversations. Decent food and drink options at reasonable prices. Great service! A new one to add to my Happy Hour destinations!

I have been to multiple CPKs and i have been to this location like 3 times and this is the first time i am doing a review because i keep forgetting what is good and what is not.:)  This rating is for my experience today only.:) l guess we ordered the right food today ordered: 1. Buffalo cauliflower - it's spicy but not too spicy. just the right amount. i wish they added more cheese because i like cheese.. but still good overall. It's surprisingly gooooooood!  2. Tequila chicken pasta - this is the one that i kept forgetting that I like! the pasta was a bit undercooked. It's,uh, a bit hard. Not sure if that's how it's supposed to be (is it??) still edible though. It doesnt taste like tequila either...  lol. and has the right amount of chicken and sauce (some CPKs put too little sauce that makes the pasta kinda dry)  3. Chicken BBQ salad -it's salad. Not much i can say abt that :) chicken to salad sa ratio is just abt right.:) and the BBQ salad wasnt overpowering.  The servers were nice and attentive. Parking isnt bad. never had problems with parking during dinner hours. If you come here often... get their app to get pizza dough points. You get free small plate once u reach certain number of points...

I have to give this place a huge shoutout for the hospitality they showed my family and I. Laura and Jaylee we're super friendly and entertaining hosts. Would definitely recommend this location and company. :)

My last time coming to CPK at Alton Square. As an HR professional I have witnessed a lot of unethical employment practices at this location. I wouldn't be surprised if any lawsuits come about. The General Manager Sam is very unprofessional. As a GM you cannot talk to your employees on the floor where other customers can hear your conversation. You don't discipline an employee in front of customers. You can't mistreat your employees when they are working hard to take care of your customers. These are hard workers and you are treating them as if they are children. That's really unprofessional. I will not eat at a place that mistreat their employees. He needs to be reprimanded or fired as this does not make the company look good. Treat your employees with respect.

My friend/coworker and I came here for lunch. We wanted to check things out since they had taken over what used to be El Cholo. I've eaten at other CPK's throughout the years and I have come to know that they have some solid pizzas. However they also have some weird ones. If the ingredients sound weird, chances are the pizza will taste weird as well! With that said, we both went with their lunch duo where I ordered a Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage pizza with a Mediterranean salad. I also got an iced tea to go with it. *Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza* It was a nice tasty thin crust 7 inch lunch size pizza. Just the right size for a personal pizza. This combination of ingredients was pretty tried and true for me, so it was a pretty safe bet that I would like it. *The Mediterranean salad* The ingredients for this salad included crisp Romaine, Roma tomatoes, garbanzos, Feta, olives and red onions with herb vinaigrette. This salad stole the show. It was better than the pizza. Our waiter gave us great service. He kept my glass filled with iced tea the whole time. It was at times a little bit too good since he was very eager to get things off of our table when he thought we were done. I'm not a big fan of pizza to begin with, so overall I'm pretty neutral to eating at any pizza restaurant. I wouldn't mind coming here again if any of my friends want to eat here. However the chances are pretty low that I will want to come here on my own accord... but I just might for their salad.

Great food. Friendly server. The inside of this one to me is the best of all local CPKs. It's very nice and pretty inside. This might be my new location yo frequent. Usually we go to the Marketplace but this one is a lot nicer!

Just wanted to give a shout out to our waitress Lora for checking up on us,  being extremely helpful, getting our food hot and just in time. Positive attitude and super energetic. Lora has gave us a world class customer service experience here at CPK! Will defiantly be coming back for more.

I've come to this CPK a few times already and love the modern decor and open air concept on the patio. Service is always friendly and the food always tastes great. I want to give a special thanks to CPK for honoring our Veterans on Veteran's Day. I took my dad - a former veteran - here to enjoy a free meal on Veteran's Day. He had the choice of a variety of salads, pastas or pizzas. We shared a great meal together and I really appreciated CPK's effort to honor all active or retired military. They even decorated the restaurant with American flags.  CPK also ran a promotion that if we purchased a gift card that day, proceeds would go to the Wounded Warriors Project. We purchased a $100 gift card, and got an additional $30 as free incentives and we helped support the WWP. Awsome! Thanks CPK!

Irvine's California Pizza Kitchen can work for lunch in Woodbridge Village. I met a client for lunch recently at this location of California Pizza Kitchen which has a more adult and chic interior to it's interior than what I am generally accustomed to. This, (and perhaps the several Yelp events held here during their opening) probably has a lot to do with the somewhat inflated aggregate score it enjoys in comparison to their franchise counterparts.  The service was solid throughout the meal but what I noticed was that the vast menu has something for everyone and deviates from the usual CPK Pizza based menu - or at least what I recall it being. Entree Salads, Fish, Poultry, and even Pasta dishes are available at the $11.00 - $20.00 price range. Of course the Pizza options are still available as well but I must admit I was pleasantly surprised with the change in direction.  On my visit I decided to try the Lunch Duo combination with a Mediterranean/Greek Salad and the California Veggie Pizza and it really was a polarizing experience. The good was the Mediterranean Salad featuring fresh from the field Romaine Lettuce, Roma tomatoes, Garbanzo Beans, Feta crumbles, Black Olives and Red Onions all tossed in a zippy and light Mustard Herb Vinaigrette. This is a fantastic little number on a hot summer day and will be ordered again upon my return visit, no question.  The bad? That California Veggie Pizza. It was awful. A far too-doughy-and-spongy crust is loaded up with Baby Broccoli (!!!), Eggplant (???), Cremini Mushrooms, Sun-dried Tomatoes, Corn (Yes - Corn. Roasted.), Red Onions and a very thin layer of Mozzarella. It actually tastes worse than it sounds and I should really seek psychological guidance after ordering this abomination of a pie. Worst Pizza ever? Damn close - I am trying to come up with something worse and have nothing.  Ugh. Blah. BLEH even. In closing, I really enjoyed the Salad but still wake up in a cold sweat from time to time when that Pizza shows up in nightmares so going forward I will call this California Salad Kitchen as they are much better at the greens than the pie.  Thanks for the read.

Great place for a casual sit down dinner. It's good for either take out or to eat in. If you eat in they bring you bread slices and olive oil, and you can request balsamic vinegar too. I've been here about 3 times so far and I've always been very happy with their service. Everyone who works there is friendly and they usually bring your food pretty quickly. Tonight we tried the hearth-roasted halibut and it was great! I highly recommend that dish. I also tried their new banh mi power bowl but I wasn't that impressed. If you're looking for something really healthy, it definitely is, but if you just care about taste they've got better things on the menu. This place is great for families or small groups.

We love CPK!! I absolutely love the mushroom sausage pizza without sundried tomatoes and my husband likes the wild mushroom strozzapretta. So delicious! And we can't leave without the delicious butter cake! My goodness I start drooling when I think of that scrumptious cake! This is why we can't come here often because it's so yummy! We have had great service each time except for once when our waiter was too busy having a conversation with the table next to us. Once the other server brought it out and I told him it was the wrong dish he brought me the right one and told me to keep the old one!

Very disappointed with our service yesterday. I took my team to celebrate and had issues with our food that was ordered (3 ppl received incorrect orders) one asked the waiter what the order was and that she did not order it, the waiter began to argue with her until my employee said "forget it, I will just eat this" we didn't receive refills on our drinks or additional bread after 25 minutes from the time we asked. I asked the waiter to please bring bread when she has a moment and she snapped back and said "I will when I'm done getting everyone's order" in a very rude tone. We will not go back to this location and will instead for to the one at fashion island which we have never had issues with.

This was my first visit to this CPK. I have been to the CPK in both Chino Hills and Brea and I have to say that this location came out on top not only because the food tasted so great but because of our server Mike R. Mike greeted us as soon as we sat down and was really attentive to our needs. For example, as soon as we finished our drink, he would see that and provide us with a refill. He also made sure to check up on us constantly to see if we needed anything or if everything tasted good. In regards to the food, everything tasted awesome! We really loved the Jambalaya pasta we ordered as well as our BBQ/Hawaiian pizza. My wife and I really look forward to having Mike as our server the next time around!

Oh man. I can't even count how many times I've been to California Pizza Kitchen. I've probably had everything on the menu at this point. When I heard that el cholo, the restaurant that was previously at this location, was closing, I was initially disappointed. I live nearby, and the proximity to a great Mexican restaurant was something I enjoyed. However, after finding out that CPK was going to take its place, I was definitely excited.  First of all, This location is BEAUTIFUL. It's very classic California, with beach themed decor and a huge California flag. There's some local inspiration too, with a photo of the spectrum big wheel, and an Irvine logo. The bar is also gorgeous. Well lit bottles line the shelves at the bottom, wine crates decorate the shelves at the top.  The service here is about what I would expect for a large restaurant that's often full with a wait at peak hours. If you come for a weekend dinner, expect a 20-30 minute wait, and a moderate wait for the food. Despite the business, the kitchen pumps out food quickly and the servers are speedy and proficient.  The food is standard CPK, nothing out of the ordinary for this location of the chain. However - if you haven't tried the butter cake, it's a must for desserts!!!

I like to come to this CPK once in a while (because it is a little pricey) when I want a casual filling meal with a citrus-y flavor. My absolute go to is the chicken tequila pasta. I don't know how they make it so damn good. My boyfriend always gets the kung pao spaghetti with chicken which also has an amazing kick of flavor. I also love the complementary bread. There aren't really any cons other than the price. Parking is great, service is great, the whole vibe of this place is just great.

This new CPK have completely remodeled and looks very neat and clean. It looks very modern aesthetic appearence. And the pizzas as always the best ones. This location have very nice parking space and Will update more with pictures soon. Tip : Don't Miss out the best dessert Butter cake and the ice cream on the top

Normally I come for their happy hours from 3-6 and sometimes 8:30- close. I'd give it about 4 or 5 stars for those experiences. Last night I was at a goodbye dinner with about 11 people. Gawd was our service slow. Could be because of hump day? I dunno why but normally waiters refill your water with pitcher- but now water has to be ordered and delivered from the bar... The food was pretty heavy- but it's expected when you eat out. Prices are on the higher dollar amount- I don't blame them- Irvine does that to ya. But they would have earned a higher star if the service was slightly better and existent.
I love this place. Canon was are server and he was beyond nice and professional. Canon was very attentive to are table needs and fast. Will definitely come back.

Don't go here. My brother ordered garlic fettuccine and specifically requested it vegetarian. Even after the server somewhat condescendingly reassured him there wont be any meat in the pasta, lo and behold, there was chicken in it. My brother bit into it before he realized it was meat, and he is a very sensitive vegetarian. I am sorry, but an apology just wasn't enough - they didn't even take the pasta off our bill, which was very insulting. My family isn't the type to complain, but we expect more when something like this happens.  I wish I could give this place zero stars - customer service is essential when you are paying close to $20 for a small plate of pasta.

I am a long time CPK lover, in fact my son worked there 3 years while in college. However one of the things I have found is the dining experience and food alter by location.  This CPK is wonderful each time! Great ambiance, I have had little wait time and the staff is fantastic!!  Max served us and did a great job, I am a former server which means I have high expectations,  he  made great suggestions..  the Thai salad and Halibut... Wow!!! Thank You!!

it's nice restaurant, no doubt about foods. but it is so frustrated that they can't serve a large group of 25 people. They don't take reservation at all & want 25 people just come & camp 1-2 hours for sitting. There is no guarantee if they will have table for all??  The manager even told me they are so busy and don't need a large group to dine.

Very good dining experience.  Had a variety of pizzas for our party of eight.  Had not refusal and gluten free pizzas and both were delicious.  Especially enjoyed the buffalo cauliflower appetizer and the spinach and artichoke pizza.  Decor was very nice and service was also very good.

Received a gift card so thought we'd have a nice dinner out. My wife had a pasta dish and loved it. I had a $28 rib eye steak and thought it lacked flavor. Was cooked to medium rare which I requested and was tender but I kept wanting to reach for the salt. I don't like blue cheese butter which it was suppose to be topped with so I asked that it be held. I just thought some other spice would have been substituted to add flavor. Loved the bread and sangria choices. Now the biggest problem and the reason we won't be returning is it's SO LOUD in there it's hard to have a decent conversation with your dinner partner!!  Seriously, some adjustments need to be made to make it a more enjoyable experience.

This was my second time at this location and the first was not as disappointing but I have to write a review this time. I had to repeat my order couple of times until she got it right on the phone, she ended up getting my name wrong even after spelling it for her. I get there and they give me the food few minutes late but idk how long it was sitting in there kitchen because the pizza was cold when I tried eating it. I ordered the veggie pizza with chicken and I had it before and it was good but this time it tasted like eating cardboard, I'm thinking they didn't put enough sauce on it or they forgot all together. I had asked for utensils and beard and they asked me again if I wanted any....

Amazing service here, Justin is a great server. Food is delicious. Great for families or just hanging out with friends. Convenient collation because there aren't many restaurants near by, so it's perfect for my family.
In response to global warming the AC is set to chill a polar bear. Bring a down coat.  Service was fair. Moroccan salad is tasty and even a half is filling

We came in for lunch because I was craving pizza and a good lunch special. I spilled my iced tea that I ordered and it took a while to get it cleaned up. But there was this manager there, I can't remember her name but she loved my phone case and she is blonde and super sweet. She reconciled the situation because I also didn't like my pizza. That was great customer service.

If you want to enjoy good food with your family, this is not the right place! I ordered California veggi with goat cheese and tortilla soup, First of all it took 30 minutes for a pizza, then she brings the pizza without cheese! When I told her, she took it back and sprinkled some goat cheese on it and brought the cold pizza right back! I never even got the soup! I had hospital food tasting better honestly ! I had california pizza so many times before and I love it but this place is a disgrace!
Love this place! They also play the games and glad they play CA teams including San Francisco teams! Food is great and very kid friendly!! Great ambiance

I usually always have a great experience when I go to CPK. For some reason the Garlic Fettuccine Alfredo was lacking flavor that day. Could have been a off day but I really hope this is not the same for the rest of the CPK's Service was great and no complaints.  I'll have to give them another shot next time.

They just opened this location near my office. I called ahead of time to place a pick up order and was assured my pizza would be ready within 15 minutes. When I got to this place they said my order was never placed. I even showed the manager my call log on my cell phone. Long story short they had to take my order again and I ended having to wait an additional 20 minutes for my food. I did not get charged for my pizza which was expected but when I got back to my office to eat lunch I opened the box and my order was not what I had asked for. Not my typical CPK experience. This location needs to get it together.  Save your time and go to the CPK at the  Irvine Spectrum.

If you can avoid using this location's take out service I would try to.  Really unfriendly employees, and when we arrived, Molly hadn't even placed the order and told us she wasn't able to at all. She told us she hadn't bothered to even call us back because she couldn't find our number.  Other CPK's in Irvine are a little more helpful.

Great spot. Super clean. Has a great staff, we have come multiple times even opening week and they have always been efficient. Keep up the good work.  The bar is my favorite area, more quaint then some places but makes more comfortable for a date or a friendly dinner..  Try the breakfast pizza!!! Bomb!!!!  Thanks everyone!! Will always come back and recommend

Excellent customer service and hospitality. Flavorful food--my all-time favorite is still the Original BBQ Chicken Salad with the avocado add-on, though I actually prefer to substitute the chicken with avocado (at no extra cost). If you request their complimentary bread, you'll find it's perfection--crisp crust, gently giving way to the contours of each bite, moist, and especially good with the seasoned olive oil.

Our family loves this restaurant. Not normally fans of chain restaurants but this place is awesome! It's family friendly and the service is really good! Everyone is helpful and upbeat. We have been going here once or twice a week so we've been able to try quite a few items on the menu.  Our two year old son loves the fusilli with meat sauce and the sausage pizza! If you want an easy, fun, family dinner with the kids, this place is great!!
I have been to several different Cal. Pizza Kitchens and this is by far the best!  Great food, atmosphere and service!  Great job and thanks for being the best!

I'm only giving this location 4 stars because of our server Mario. He was awesome. The food was not so good, our bread was cold and the strawberry mango cooler was not up to par, however Mario made up for the bad food.

I placed two online orders here this week for Curbside Pickup. The only reason I am giving three stars is both orders had all of the correct items. Curbside.  Doesnt seem to exist here.  I sat in the 10 minute parking spot for 15 minutes waiting.  So did the car next to me.  They finally got out of their car and went inside, so I did as well.  They had two people working in the Takeout area, and all of our food was sitting there waiting.  Their order had about 15 items or more.  My orders were for 5 people, and 1 person.  Everything was ready, so why they didnt bring it out to the car, is beyond me. The food in my order completely wrecked my stomach.  I was extremely sick the rest of the day. I will pass on ordering from here again, and definitely skip on the non-existent curbside.
Kitchen closed at 9:30pm when it says that it's open until 10:00pm so ridiculous! You need to update your hours of operations. False advertisement.
Megan at take out is so nice and helpful ! She got me in and out very quick. I recommend the fusili pasta with the garlic cream sauce

I have only done take-out, so never worried about service--but they all seemed friendly doing take-out. I LOVE the Buffalo Cauliflower!  Very tasty, not too breaded or too spicy or too vinegary.  Ranch dressing is great on it.
Loving CPK more lately. Really great tasting food and with many unique fushion and tastes.
Walked in and there were other people ahead of us waiting to be seated. Servers and waitress didn't even bother to acknowledge us after seeing us. Everyone ended up leaving. That's terrible service.

Yummy. CPK is a sit down restaurant. These are 3 reasons I recommend CPK (California Pizza Kitchen) One thing I like about California Pizza Kitchen is the food is heavenly. First of all, the pizza sauce is fresh and tastes amazing. They balance the cheese with the sauce and the crust perfectly as well as all the other food. Also, the crust is crunchy so you have to love it. On your pizza, you can get meat, parmesan cheese, pepperoni, mushroom, and other things. That's why the food is heavenly.    The food has different sizes like kids, personal, and group. There many different pasta's like pasta with sauce and other types. You can also get soup that is delicious. Another thing I like about California Pizza Kitchen is the dessert. My favorite dessert is the ice cream brownie because the vanilla ice cream has a fantastic flavor and the brownie is baked to perfection. Also, there is a kids sized size that is equally amazing. There is a kids ice cream sundae which has awesome toppings like a melted cream. Those are reasons I love the desserts.  The last thing I like about California Pizza Kitchen is you get everything very quick. When you are coming into the parking lot, you find a spot straight away and if someone steals your parking you find more parking straight away. After that, you go inside and get a seat at the bar or a normal seat. At the bar you can see them cook it which is fascinating. You order your drinks and they bring them instantly. Your food comes faster than it takes to add 1 + 1. Those are things that you get  very fast.   Those were three reasons why I  recommend California Pizza Kitchen.

Went to the CPK today in Irvine for a late lunch with my son and had a very nice meal.  All the CPK's have good food basically, but the reason for this review is to compliment the server, Chanell, for her excellent service. From start to finish she made the experience a very pleasant one.  She is attentive, friendly and sincerely cares about her customers!

My boyfriend and I had stopped going to CPK for years because we just had bad memories/experiences from it. We noticed this location was new and decided to give it a try. We're glad to did! This new experience we had has totally changed our perspective of the brand. We sat the the pizza counter and enjoyed watching them form the dough and placing the toppings on there. How they can keep track of all the pizzas and ensure they're perfect is truly amazing. The servers kept busy and worked with a sense of urgency.  The quality and taste of food is good. My boyfriend and I had stopped going to casual dining concepts altogether, but now that we are revisiting them we are liking the changes we are seeing and the prices! Cocktails are very affordable here for compared to what you would pay at other places.

I hadn't been to a CPK in years, but after a recent Yelp event here I learned that the menu has completely changed. And it's a huge improvement from a couple years ago. First of all, I was blown away by the service. I was first greeted outside the door by a host with an iPad to check me in. Since I was alone, I opted to sit at the pizza bar rather than take up a table. This was a great choice. At the pizza bar you are right in front of the kitchen and can watch everything being made. There was a family next to me with two kids and the chefs have them each some pizza dough to play with while their food was cooking. I had never seen that before, but it was very cool. The kids were having a blast learning how to make a pizza crust. My waiter, Marvin, was outstanding. He was super informative, always smiling and energetic, and constantly ready to refill drinks and answer questions.  The spicy sausage flatbread appetizer was very good, but the cedar plank salmon was excellent. They brought it out with the cedar still smoldering and smelled amazing. The salmon was perfectly cooked and juicy. It was served with limes for the salmon and a very tasty corn, spinach, and feta succotash side dish. The dessert menu is excellent as well. Butter cake, salted caramel pudding, s'mores, red velvet cake, etc. I chose the key lime pie and it had a wonderful graham cracker crust and tasted like authentic key limes, not the fake key lime many restaurants serve.  All in all I was impressed. Although they have kept most of their classics (i.e. Thai Chicken pizza), the rest of the menu is fresh, new, and from what I have tasted so far it is excellent. Despite being a chain (which I normally am not a fan of), it feels more like a local hang out now. I expect I will be back.
Great service and very friendly staff. This branch also still serves the chicken penne cream pasta. Other locations have discontinued it. The spinach artichoke dip is an all time favorite!

For being such a huge national chain I like CPK, best pizza it is not though. I went with a large salad and it was just that, big and filling, by mo means healthy, but tasty. Liked the egg rolls as a app, again not the best quality, but tasty and fried so that makes everything better. Service was fine, food came out quickly and was hot and fresh. The man enjoyed his meat pizza, I think pretty steep for the size and quality you get. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back here given the great dining options in the area but our dinner was A-OK.

Did not know this location even existed. The food was good, the service was fine and I think that all CPK's get a five star from me. I love the original BBQ chicken also the Jamaican Jerk pizza is good. Most of the salads they offer are awesome, I have nothing but great things to say about this place.

Recently had dinner at this CPK location, and it was a great experience once Isabella became our server.  She was very professional, efficient, and friendly, and offered additional sauces for our dinner items and bread to go - very pleasant experience.  (I would give it a 5, but before Isabella came along, we felt like we were on an island waiting for a rescue ship to come along - In the beginning, another server did a drive-by, put some coasters on our table, and then he said "I'm just here to say Hi, I'll come back later".  He never came back.)

New location, great looking interior, friendly staff...  Not sure about the new look CPK is going for with their Anthorpologie, Crate and Barrel, Fig & Olive type of style, but I just did not feel very comfortable. I like the old CPK look with their booths and white interior.  Maybe because this place was so new but the food wasn't as good either. Had their thai salad that I always love, and it was not as fresh and not very good. Also tried their seasonal pizza with egg and bacon. It had 2 eggs and maybe one bacon sliced up on the pizza.  I'll probably be visiting the Spectrum location if I want CPK.

California pizza Kitchen has been a longtime staple for quick lunch meetings. Their pizza and salads are reasonably priced, nicely proportioned and taste good. So far, the employees at this location have been super friendly and happy to serve. I love that I can get in and out within a short period of time and most people can find something they like on the menu.

One of the best CPK's by far!!! Love the cool casual vibe!! Newly built location! Absolutely beautiful and new everything! The food especially the pizza is AMAZING as always!! The location is great, easy to get to from the 405 & the 5 freeways.  The waiters are soooo friendly and accommodating! Love this place!!!

Service has not been the greatest, given that we are here at least once a week and at times, without a crowded bar it takes a lot to get the bartender's attention.  But today I finally tried the recommended dessert, butter cake. I'm in heaven!  Delicious!  Also the mushroom pasta was excuisite!  Will continue to patron and hope that service improves.

We went to CPK last night- on opening night and a school night none the less. We signed in and were told waiting was and 1hr. Ok no problem it was expected. An hour later we checked in and kept being told by the girl at the for 5 more minutes for another 20 minutes. I finally asked to speak with a manger who apologized and assisted in getting us seated.  Once we were seated it was a VERY pleasant experience.  Our server was a very nice man- Nobody- is his name. He was very patent with our daughters got us our drinks and bread right away.  Our meals came shortly after, I appreciated how EVERYONE from bussboy to managers kept constantly checking in on your tables checking to see if you needed refills, bread etc.  Our dinner was delicious, fresh and hot.  Dessert was amazing= we ordered the bread pudding with ice cream. The location is excellent and the decor inside is very modern, updated and neat.  The main reason I will go back is because of our AMAZING server who's real name is NOBODY. He was great. He shared and amazing, inspiring story about his name and was just an all around nice server. He was patient, funny, took his time with recommendations and constantly checked in on our tables despite the fact that we could tell he had many. He made us all laugh and he even made a big deal for my daughters "First day of 1st grade celebration"

Nice addition to the neighborhood. They have a bar with a couple tv's for sports. Mediocre beers on tap, hopefully add some good local craft beers in the future. The outside patio is excellent. On Saturday nights they have live entertainment outside which is awesome. The food is just ok, a bit overpriced for what it is. The staff and management seems to be very good.

This is one of the worse CPKs I've been to. My kids love to eat their pesto cream penne pasta dish. This place is the worse they can't get it right. I order it with no sun dried tomatoes. So many time it comes out with it. Also something off about how there cooks prepare it. The place is new but they just can't get it right. It's closer to my house so I've been going there. No more. Last straw. Going to other CPKs. Avoid this branch. They still learning.

I've been a couple of times to this place and I can say I won't go there again. Pizza - you would think they should have a great pizza since this seems to be their specialty see their name (LOL): veggie pizza is a joke, has a weird sweet taste maybe the pizza sauce? I cannot fathom. The cheese taste has nothing to do with mozzarella, it is rather tasteless chalk. Anytime I order takeout they mess up the order, if you order extras they don't honor them but you'll be charge for them (it happened twice). In conclusion, no thanks I won't get back.
