Thought it would be a good idea to eat here since it just opened and was probably clean and it was but the food was trash. Took about 30 minutes to get the food and the pizza was burnt as hell and my Kung pao spaghetti was undercooked. Go to a different location. Never had any problems with other locations. Overall a terrible experience. The only thing good was the waiter who was kind
Always consistently good.  However bar service needs A LOT of help.  Drinks take way too long to get.

I always thought that CPK was synonymous with screaming kids and so-so food. I was shockingly surprised when I walked in yesterday.!!! The Irvine-Alton location was not like the Irvine Spectrum location at all. Overly friendly staff from the host to the two wait staff. I really liked the lime green walls and decor. The restaurant was very open, clean and had strategically placed dining sections. I only hope there is a section for families. There was one screaming kid in the waiting area just to remind me that I was indeed at CPK. I had a spinach mushroom flatbread that had a nice thin crust- very tasty!  The menu had an okay wine list. I love the 6oz and 9oz wine options, they even have fish and steak options. The bar looked inviting-- the decor, Tito's vodka and a full bar all just a block away in which I can walk to.....look out IPD!

We had what could have been a deal-breaking bad experience tonight - CPK's online ordering system glitched and deleted our order. This happened well past our usual dinnertime with a hungry family - on a school night, no less. When I tried to order by phone, I found out I was starting over, which set my order back 40 minutes. I wrote it off to a first day snafu for this new location, which we knew would be very busy. But what a surprise... when our dinner was brought to us curbside, a super apologetic employee told us that one of our meals plus an appetizer were comped. Very gracious and much appreciated! While we usually prefer to dine in, it was nice to avoid the crowds and yet still receive a meal just as great as if we had eaten there. Welcome to the neighborhood, CPK. See you again in a few days, I'm sure.

The food is amazing and the Belgian Chocolate Soufflé cake is just out of this world!! The best we've EVER had. According to my daughter "The cake was just perfect, the outside of the cake was like you are biting into a chocolate bar until the gushy inside explodes into your mouth. But that's not all, to top it off they had put a delicious vanilla ice cream that was nice and creamy. And on the bottom there was a vanilla bean cream sauce." Thank you so much: Brian B. For serving us on this busy Friday night! We're definitely coming back!
Service at this location is PAINFULLY SLOW.  I guess I'll stick with the CPK in the Tustin marketplace.

This is one the better locations.  I also like the fact that they have a bar area is you just want to go and have a glass of wine or while you are waiting.  The service was pretty good.  We were a large group and the server was able to keep up without ignoring other customers.  I really dislike when the servers are so busy catering to big groups that they ignore the smaller parties.  It was a little loud but I guess that is to be expected (we weren't the really loud ones - lol).  I would go back to place again.  The only drawback is the parking.  It is in a shopping center and sometimes is a little difficult to find parking
great food. i love the location. very friendly personal. Will be back soon. Oh and did i mention their  prepaid card deal from costco?

What a great location, upbeat, friendly staff, and family oriented. When we went for dinner it was packed. So good to see for a new location. Tarryn was absolutely awesome! So friendly and so motivated working a double shift. Great positive attitude. Food was perfect. Our family will be coming back again and again. Great job!

I went opening night with my friends and had a blast. We started off with some wine and beer, then tried some of the appetizers and the Mac 'N Cheese was to die for! My friends ordered the salmon, pizza and I had the rib eye, the food was really good. Our server Ashley was amazing and very detailed. It was packed and super busy. I really love the new look. The Moscato wine I had was really great and would buy a bottle next time.

Don't order the Chinese Chicken salad.  They use stale lettuce, put very few wontons and provide stale bread with it.  This is bad. Take it from a loyal CPK customer but not from this location.  TERRIBLE

The Good -  Love the menu - food was very good as usual per CPK everywhere. I'll be getting a lot of takeout here. Some creative seasonal items.  Service was top notch - made a big deal about a birthday which was nice. Decor is really pretty. I like all of the wood - though it doesn't do much for noise.  Music on the bar patio a nice touch - too bad that quiet vibe did not translate inside.  The Bad -  OMG the noise level!!! Don't go if you want to have an actual conversation with more than one person - spent the whole night saying "what?" Seriously that is enough to keep me away and I really want this place to succeed for the sake of the neighborhood. Please turn off the loud music - it only makes it harder to hear your companions! Not kidding I left with ringing in my ears.  Food also took a bit longer to arrive than you might expect. But that's a little forgive able on a Sat night.  Go early on weekends or expect a wait. At least for now while it's new.

Where can I buy a decibel meter? This new location is so loud I think my ears are still ringing from last night. I think the employees will have a really good CalOSHA claim.  We complained to the manager and she said she would also bring it to the attention of the company. She was so nice that we didn't have the heart to also tell her how poor the service was. What happened to having a single waitperson who has accountability over your table? We had to beg various random staff members for drinks, etc. I also think it's weak when a random "server" shows up with three out of the four entrees and has no idea of to whom the plates belong.  On the other hand, and other than my sadly limp pizza, the food was pretty good.

Just came from dinner at our local CPK.  WOW, is for the great service from Kevin.  He made our night special.  He has to be one of the best waiters I've ever had.  Fantastic service.  Great attitude.  Handwritten card from the staff and a delicious dessert for our special occasion.  A big THANK YOU.

My first time at CPK, Me and my family started off with some drinks, My wife and I ordered some sangria with different flavors each, it was nicely served like the pictures on the drink menu and tasted just as well, my compliment to the Bar!! Food was awesome, Had some pasta while my kid had some pizza and wife had some soup. We were all happy with our meal and our server "Nobody" took care of us in excellent, he did a great job (Nobody is his name btw). Planing our next dinner next month. Prices are fair, just what I expected, but did not break bank.

My husband and I just had a dinner here.  My husband had pasta dish and I had myself 2 slices of pizza.  It was delicious and I love their salad.  The service overall was good but not great.  The restaurant itself well kept.  I would cone back occasionally

I was greeted by and helped by the most sweetest and helpful hostess I have ever met!!! We waited 20 minutes for a table but SARAH kept checking on us telling us our table would be ready soon. She was busy helping everyone and her smile made the wait worth it!!!

I have been a regular at CPK. First time at this location. I had heard that this was a noisy location and it sure didn't disappoint. The restaurant was not even full and the noise level was so bad I could hardly hear my wife speaking. As for the food... My wild mushroom pizza was average. The spinach dip with chips was luke warm. We also ordered chicken melanaise. We almost always get that. All three pieces of chicken that came out were burnt. Our waiter never checked on us the entire time we were here, only to give us the bill. He was nice but not efficient. We actually had to get up and chase down the manager to get a refund. Not recommended at this location! I am being very generous in giving this place two out of five stars.

Just picked up my togo order the food probably tastes great however they said that i ordered at the wrong location and i had to wait another 15 minutes with people waiting for me. Anyways apparently their number is wrong but the number on yelp works however they said that their number doesnt start with 949-396 and that its 949-394. However if u call their yelp number it says 396 and works and they picked up and took my order. Awesome food though ! Haha :) thats why i give 3/5 maybe 2.5 if their food wasnt good i would be writing more lol they even said my name because they had my number in the system so obviously someone didn't put in my order after they repeated it to me on the phone. They joked it off in light manner that it happens all the time and that i might have called the wrong number but to prove it and check myself i went on my phone and yelp and call history to make sure and I was in fact at the right store showing I was arrived at my destination as well haha.
Great atmosphere walking in. Great service provided by Davon! I order tortilla soup and blue moon! I know totally don't go together but still both delicious! I will be coming back.

Had an awesome dinner here tonight. The food came out extremely quick and was delicious. The service was amazing and Mary took great care of us. Never let our glasses go empty and was super knowledgeable about the menu. I would definitely recommend this cpk.
We went for the first time & manager brought us chips & guacamole appetizer on the house.....it was amazing!  Plus the service was excellent & we will go back again soon!

Just a "food" for thought... I ordered online and selected a time to get my food to go.  Have a short window for work and time is pretty important.  Literally 17 minutes after I arrived I get my food.  Finally the manager came out to assist.  The problem was I know one has to train the host and it is a different job classification, but while a group of us were waiting, the host literally was just standing there sipping on his drink.  No fault of his own but the poor guy at the takeout was doing the best he could while the rest of the restaurant was nearly empty.  Perhaps we can train the host, have the manager help out sooner, or develop a system to where he can ask for help?

Had a major hankering for some 'za, so I grabbed a take-out pie one afternoon. Customized a BBQ chicken pizza with some jalapeños and bacon, and replaced the mozz with goat cheese. OMG it was soooo incredible! I overate.

Oh my goodness!!!!!  We first sat down by the bar and no one even looked at us for like 30 mins and then we went to the front and asked for a booth . Once we sat down, we waited again another 10 mins until we stopped a waiter and asked him for a menu. After finally getting our menu we quickly ordered and my husbands pizza was filled with mushrooms when it wasn't even a mushroom pizza and I had asked for a gluten free pizza as I have an allergy to gluten and they gave me a regular pizza!  Finally they brought everything right and then when we get the bill, we got charged for something we never even got.   We came to CPK to relax after a busy and stressful Friday work day and we ended up leaving stressed .   Such a nice looking CPK yet they don't have their ish together .  Quite frustrating

Wow! I am so impressed with the level of service at this CPK location. This has to be the best experience I've ever had at this chain. The hostess was such a sweetheart and so kind to me while she seated us. Our server was super attentive and right on point with everything. What a great dinner we had here! I'm so glad we happened to be in the area and eat here. The decor was very SoCal and cool unlike any other locations I've been to. Awesome all around! My fave CPK now

Unfortunately service was bad. The place wasn't very busy and no one refilled water or cleared plates. It took us some time to find our waitress to refill our water. I understand slow when a place is busy, but when half the tables are empty and staff and waiters are all around, I expect better service. It would be nice if it was the type of place where anyone could notice 6 people in need of water and refill it. Food was fine, just wish service was actually service.

These 5 stars are solely for Sam Rogers, the general manager at this location. My boyfriend and I attempted to have dinner here yesterday and while the service was less than stellar, Sam took it upon himself to make sure our experience and view of CPK was not tainted. Thank you for going out of your way to make sure we left on a good note. They are lucky to have such a great manager.

The management at the Alton/Jeffrey location of CPK needs some work. I've been to this location twice since they opened about a month ago and both times the timing of the kitchen has been very bad.  First experience was lunch by myself, sitting at the bar, about a week after they had the grand opening. Restaurant was not crowded and it was about 2pm, so not a lunch rush. My food, a half order BBQ chicken salad, took about 45 minutes to come out. Bartender/server apologized repeatedly. Whatever. Second experience was a take-out order on a Friday night, about 6pm. Called the local number to the CPK, but got a call center representative. I had a question about an ingredient so the rep transferred me to the restaurant directly. Spoke with the take-out staff, put my order in, and they recommended I come in about 30 minutes for pickup. Once I arrived, it was clear I was going to wait a long time. At least four people ahead of me looked very unhappy and impatient. I saw the shift manager offer to pay one customer's take-out dinner and also gave the customer a free dessert due to the long wait. Once it was my turn, they told me they had to wait on one of my pasta dishes. Well, that wait for one pasta dish turned into 65 minutes (for a total of 95 minutes since I first put the order in). The other food on my order, a pizza, a salad, and some soup, were all ready and sitting on a counter. I asked about the food sitting there and the man at the counter just smiled and put the food in a warming oven behind him. I wasn't happy that my food was just sitting around while one pasta dish was holding up the whole order.  I watched one by one as the manager had to come to the front of the restaurant to apologize to at least three other take-out customers for the delay. I waited for my apology, but didn't seem to be getting one until I had to point out to the manager that most of my order was ready and sitting around while one dish was not up yet. Finally, the manager blamed the take-out call center, then he blamed the kitchen staff being slammed, then he blamed it being a Friday night (you know, a busy night). He offered to comp the pasta dish. Fine, I thought. Then when the pasta dish came out, it was the wrong dish.  Until this new location can get the kinks out, I say stay away.

I haven't been to CPK for years, and was really expecting this place to be mediocre as far as the food. First, staff was very friendly here. Decor & ambiance was very intimate. Paintings & displays on the walls gives you a true, vivid perception of what California is about.  I had the jambalaya fettuccine, and my girlfriend had the original BBQ chicken pizza. My fettuccine was very flavorful, and right amount of spice. Noodles were not over cooked.  For dessert, we took hole the butter cake with ice cream. Even after eating it at home, for the price, the butter cake wasn't bad at all. Not dry, sweetness was good, nice and MOIST! The FORKS were a bit weird as the prongs were very close together, which affects the amount of food can be picked up. Our server was a sweetheart. She was very attentive, made us feel comfortable & welcomed, and was apologetic when she felt she was falling behind (even though she wasn't).  Their menu in the store has a lot more of a selection than the one online.  Giving this place 5 STARS as it was a lot better than what I expected & have experienced in the past.

I was really impressed by their service yesterday. Every employee we encountered was super nice and accommodating. Our server even wrote the date we ate on our to go boxes so we would be able to know when it went bad! My toddlers also spilled a glass of water all over the table, like he does at every outing, and immediately people came to help us. The decor was also very nice and updated compared to the Michelson locationgreat place for a family dinner!

Noisy, noisy, noisy, and then on top of that, a group at a nearby table celebrating a birthday. Their overly loud, bordering-on-obnoxious singing of Happy Birthday was bad enough, only to be followed shortly thereafter by very loud in-your-face obnoxious "singing". My friend and I had had more than enough at that point, and simultaneously blurted out to them to keep it down.  Rather than realizing how loud and disturbing they had become, they verbally lashed out at us, from across the room, that we should leave the restaurant, and that they could say anything they wanted. Instead of getting into it with these low-lifes, who should have just gone to a noisy bar for their "spirited" celebration, I asked the manager on duty, Edson, to take control of the restaurant by asking the noisy patrons to chill out. Rather than do that, Edson chose to defend the raucous group. So if you want to spend money going out to eat to a place that is already very noisy, where you can hear from across the room every plate and piece of silverware being bussed,  conversations going on nearby and from afar, and can barely hear your own server who's standing right at your table, knock yourself out. And if there are any loud, rude, self-centered low-lifes there taking over the space with their disturbing voices, you can rest assured that the management shares their low-life values of not caring at all about the Other paying customers who are keeping their conversations and behavior to themselves. CPK at this location has become Part of the Problem instead of Part of the Solution.

I called in my order, and arrived 5 minutes earlier than when I was told my order would be ready. I had ordered the shaved mushroom and spinach flatbread. My order was already ready when I arrived, and it ended up being cold. Although I ate it anyway, I was not thrilled that what was supposed to be a hot meal was cold. This does not make me happy. I don't want to have to dine in at CPK in order, to guarantee receiving a hot meal. Also, it just didn't taste well, yes it's a flatbread, but did it have to be flat in it's taste too?!
Bad serves bad server expense tastelessness won't even give it one * the food came late only one server in I tire setting area!

So, having been to many CPKs over the years, I thought I'd give this new location a shot.  It was about 90° outside and they have some employee standing at the door, with the door wide open allowing the precious A/C to escape while allowing the miserable heat in, greeting you.  While it may be a nice gesture, it is completely annoying.  Not quite as annoying as being serenaded, like Macaroni Grill used to do.  This isn't some posh restaurant.  It's CPK, for crying out loud.  Speaking of loud, the restaurant was just that.  LOUD!!  The acoustics are terrible.  The decor is updated compared to others I've been to.  Urban and sparse.  Meh.  Nothing to write home about.  (I'm not writing home here, people.  Gimme a break.)  Their food was just okay...except for the Avocado Club Egg Rolls.  Those are delicious!  I made the mistake of ordering the Crispy Mac 'n' Cheese.  I actually said as I ordered them, "Ya can't go wrong with macaroni and cheese."   I spoke too soon.  They were overcooked, and the cheesy insides had coagulated.  Our server, Brian, was nice and attentive.  Oh, don't let me forget the parking lot.  Not their fault.  It has been, and continues to be, a busy lot with too few spots...and poorly designed.  An accident waiting to happen.  Tip:  Go when it's not typically busy.  Like, don't go during traditional lunch time or dinnertime.   In any case, I'm actually writing this review to fill time.  See, like a moron, I think I left my credit card there two days ago.  I called almost half an hour ago asking if they could check for me.  I was placed on hold for a brief period of time and another girl came on the line and actually said, "The best thing you could do is come here with your ID and we can let you know if we have it."  Ummm, no.  That isn't exactly the best thing I could do.  I could hold while you check for me so I don't have to drive all the way there with the possibility of being told it isn't there.  That would be the best thing.  Well, next to not having lost it in the first place.  She'll look...when she has a chance, and will call me back.  Thank you.  And so I wait. Update...yes, like a moron, I did leave it there.  I have never done that in my life.  Really.  The manager, Kyle, called me back within 30 minutes, and was very nice about it all.  So, off I go.

Love CPK but this location is the loudest restaurant I have ever been in. If you want to relax and have a good meal, forget about it. Whoever designed this place should be fired. My recommendation is go visit Daily Grill on Jamboree to see how they used glass to reduce the noise level. This location unlike the Tustin market location is extremely loud like a cafeteria. You need to fix this. With parking not being great, it's a death spiral. Food is good!

In general I quite like this place. One never has to wait too long and service is not bad. In my opinion CPK loses one star for being overpriced, the other star is lost because CPK is not at all generous with the toppings on their pizzas. The roasted garlic chicken pizza I had a few days ago only had five small pieces of chicken on it. All of their pizzas have the same problem: not enough toppings!

Since when is CPK a fine dining restaurant? Because they didn't tell their staff that's what they're going for. Came here today with some friends for lunch and we ordered an appetizer and each ordered a lunch special. The food that did come was pretty tasty.   Unfortunately we didn't get the appetizer because the waiter just forgot to put it in. He didn't offer to get it later for us instead or anything. They also ran out of bread in the middle of our meal - how can an Italian food place run out of bread?? Anyways, it was ok at best.
Best CPK ever! I guess it's kind of a "concept/test location" with a new menu & vibe. We loved it! Sat on their patio with our doggies & had a great time! My chicken dish was 4 Stars!!

Wow, I was surprised at how packed it was here on a Sunday for dinner. There were many large groups here celebrating bdays or something. This CPK has a nice ambiance for reasonable price and that's why so many people flock here. They can have a nice sit down dinner or for a causal meal.  I was here just for a causal dinner and we were seated quickly. Ordered two different pizzas and the roasted veggie salad. I prefer the hand tossed dough for my pizza. I love the chew of the dough with the crust at the edges. The SO preferred the thin crust pizza and it's much more crunchy. Both are well done so it's good that they have something for everyone's varying tastes. The roasted veggie salad was good, the artichokes were bordering on burnt rather than roasted and it was over dressed. The full size portion is quite large so next time I'd probably ask for half and less dressing. The bread they also provide is very good. It's a freshly baked sourdough and it's so nicely crunchy and crusty but I love the soft inside. The only downside is on this busy night they seemed to have issue with keeping up with making the bread so we didn't get it until almost the same time as our entrees.  I would come back as this is a nice restaurant with a good variety of dishes. The only complaint besides the slowness of bread was that our waitress was a bit of a Debbie downer. I kind of understand as it seemed like it was very busy so she's probably tired but still being in the service industry she should still try to hide the resting face a little.

Food = 3 Service = 4 Ambience = 3 Noise Level = 1 I won't be coming back here.  Maybe if we ate outside.  It was so noisy inside the restaurant.  We had to yell at each other. I had asked our server for lemon with my drink but he never brought any. The food was ok.  The Tortilla spring rolls appetizer was pretty good.  We tried all three:  Mediterranean Veggie with Marinara, Baja chicken with Guacamole, Thai Chicken with Peanut Sauce.  We shared The Works pizza.

Extremely disappointed. I've been a huge fan of CPK for a long time so when I heard they were opening a new location near me, I was super excited. However I never expected such a horrible experience. We arrived here at 9pm on a Sunday, checked in and were told that there will be a 15 minute wait. Which was a little confusing because there wasn't anyone else waiting and there were all kinds of unoccupied tables, from where we can see. Never the less, we patiently set and waited. 20 minutes later a staff member came over, not to apologize for the wait but to inform us that the wait was going to be around 45 minutes. When we ask for an explanation, she acted agitated, stressed out. Her explanation was that the kitchen was backed up with ticket orders and they were incapable of handling additional orders. We were so confused by this explanation and were trying to process it. However without us replying or reacting to her explanation, she immediately called the manager in charge to provide his version of why the kitchen was backed up. To make a long story short... When the manager shows up, he refuses to sit us down at one of many opened tables because they were not going to be able to take our food order for over 45 minutes. He gave us the following 2 options: we could sit at the bar and order drinks only or leave. What the heck!!! I don't know about anyone else, but this is a new one for me. Never before have I experienced a manager refused to accept business.  Therefore beware that at this location, the on site management team poses very little customer service skills, and they are over all incompetent. I will not recommend this location to anyone. Best to go to the one at spectrum or tustin market place.

Ok I don't know about the negative comments below because I had incredible service not just from one person but everyone there. I came by because it's literally in my neighborhood so thought of it as a convenience. I'm actually glad I had dinner here because my food was great and the service topped it off. The decor isn't standard cpk which is good. A definite recommendation!  PS, try the salted Carmel pudding. It's delicious!

Just had dinner here tonight with a party of 6. despite how busy it looked we were seated in 3-5 minutes. Easy to find and ample amount of parking. Our server Devon was one of the best servers I have had anywhere! He was very friendly, quick, and helpful. Main reason for the 5 stars.  The bread and oil is great! We had the humus appetizer which was delicious, but not enough bread for the humus. We asked for more and charged $1. We had the signature bbq chicken pizza and the club pizza. Both were very good. Most of us were raving about the bbq chicken! Sooooo good!  Overall, very quick in and out. Outstanding service! And great food!! Keep it up guys! And don't lose Devon!

Went to lunch with some friends at the new CPK today and it was a completely different experience than any other CPK I have been in. The restaurant was completely redesigned inside and out...fresh vibes, bright aesthetic and a much more modern floor plan and layout. A really great new impression on the CPK brand. The food was great and the service was quick for a busy lunch rush. This was their pre-grand opening... but the service seemed to be pretty dialed in. We shared the Cobb salad, and split the Hawaiian and BBQ chicken pizzas. The Pizza came out piping hot from the oven and was delicious. I think our office lunch bunch will need to add this into our rotation!

I don't go to CPK much nowadays. The product quality has deteriorated rapidly at the diminishing rate of no return. In most cases, same with the service. I know this one opened last week and figured that if anything, service and product would probably be top notch in the beginning, so I decided to stop by an hour ago.  The people at the front were very welcoming; I was seated with no issues. The server (Natalie)was very professional and nice. The food...shockingly, was good. Everything tasted the way it should.  The White Corn Guac was very good. It had flavor and was not bland. I was skeptical about ordering it because every time I had ordered it in the past, it would taste different each time; usually bland as if a key ingredient was missing...never consistent. The Baja Rolls were very good and had adequate portions of each ingredient. That's a first in a long time with CPK. The lunch BBQ Pizza was extremely good. It brings back memories of CPK in the early 90s when things were consistently good and of quality.  The server was very nice, punctual and accommodating. Other employees (chef, manager...I believe, and other servers) stopped by and inquired about service, refilled my water and took plates away.  I really hope that this location does not change a thing no matter how established they become. I know places usually provide top notch product and service in the very beginning and usually deteriorate over time, but how about staying this way permanently?  Otherwise, if and when I'm really craving CPK, I may have to lookup the new locations that opened within weeks and go there.

This restaurant is absolutely amazing. We were looking for a place to eat then we saw California pizza kitchen and decided to eat there, it is the best pizza I've ever had, and I've had a lot of pizza in the past, I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking for a delicious place to eat, I will surely be returning for more pizza at California pizza kitchen.

Kung Pao Spaghetti!!! I was really excited when I saw this location opening nearby. My boyfriend and I came here on a Thursday night and the wait was 40 minutes! I guess this place is a convenient location for a lot of people. We just browsed around the other shops in the plaza to pass time. The bar and pizza counter is open seating but there was no room :( The restaurant looked super busy and it seemed like they had a lot of take out orders to fill. After getting seated, we noticed service was a little slow and frantic. Food didn't seem to be coming out for anyone. We ordered the BBQ chicken salad, pizza, and Kung Pao Spaghetti. The salad was up to par, and the pizza was okay, but the Kung Pao Spaghetti didn't taste as good as I remembered it to be.  Although the service was slow, I guess we were lucky all our food (including the complimentary bread) came out at once since at the table next to ours, everyone got their food except for one kid.. and then his food finally came out when his family finished eating. Hopefully the take out experience is better.

This is a new concept restaurant/menu for CPK and my husband and and I were pleasantly surprised!  Last night we had dinner here and I had the shrimp scampi zucchini ribbon and my husband the garlic roasted chicken.  The food did take a little longer than usual to come out, but it was worth it!  My dish was very tasty and fresh!  The garlic was not overpowering with a hint of sweetness.  My husband's chicken and veggies were amazing!  Perfectly seasoned and cooked, even our 18 month old who does not like white meat ate it!!  Now that this is only a few minutes away from home, it may become our go-to take out spot!   I'd like to try the rib-eye next time!  Nice job CPK!
Very slow service. It took almost 20 min just to get our bread and drinks. Never coming back again.

First time going to this location. Sat at the bar to watch SNF and the first glass poured had a big chip on the top of the glass. I didn't make a big deal about it, just didn't drink from that side. I then ordered another beer and told the bartender about he glass and was completely ignored. As once being in his shoes, I really was taken back that he dismissed my relaxed approach and careless personality. This guy had one job request from me, to pour me a beer, and he couldn't do that properly and with a personable attitude. Appetizer portions are small. Beers are overpriced as well. I live around the corner and was looking forward to have a local place to go.  I'll never be going back!

I was disappointed with the service. I expected better from a newly opened restaurant. I couldn't tell if our server just hadn't served before, or if she was super new to it. She didn't anticipate our needs. For example: My boyfriend asked for a beer from the menu and she returned to our table to let us know they were out of that beer. He then said he needed a minute to decide on food and noticed a moment later that there's a local beer list available. So when the server returned, he asked to see the list. The server should have offered the list when she returned with the news that the first beer he ordered was out. Our server also took a reallllly long time to notice I needed a box for my leftover food. And she took forever to give us the bill. Considering we were there at the end of the night when we were probably her last table, I would have expected she pay more attention to us, if for no other reason but to get us out of the restaurant after closing. I saw her and another server standing and talking for a while. The food and the decor, however, were great. I'm happy with the revamp of their style. More modern and clean. I had the Asparagus + Arugula Salad and the macaroni and cheese. Both were tasty. I'll be back because I like the food, and this new location is near my place. I hope the service is better next time, though.

Probably one of he most nicest looking CPK I've ever been to. The atmosphere is very urban and rustic inside. It looks like a place you would come in and have wine tasting or something.  Service on the other hand is not that great. Waiting time depends on what time of the day you come. Could be seated right away or wait for a few minutes. Came to dine in during a normal time. It wasn't that busy but there were a few people eating inside as well. They take a very long time to get your order and get your food out to you. And when you wait you would think that you'd get their complimentary bread right away but you still don't. We had to ask our server if they even gave it out anymore.  I also came back for a curb side order. Have never done it before so I had no high expectations. I called and told them the model of my car. I expected someone to come out right away since they know you can see them through their glass door, but no one came. Waited 10 minutes and watched as the workers talked to each other the whole time. But the annoying part is that the person who pulled up after me got someone to come out for them right away. No one ever came out so I called and just ordered for takeout instead.  If their food didn't taste so good I probably wouldn't come back anymore. My favorite pizza is the Pad Thai Pizza. Not your average type of pizza but it's really good. My favorite pasta is the Garlic Cream Fettuccine with shrimp. Always a big fan of anything creamy instead of marina style.  Overall, just like every other CPK I have been too, service and waiting time is the worst. I hope they improve on that because I love their food.

Being a relatively new restaurant to the area, I expected some hiccups. However, I was pleasantly surprised that the staff was wonderful and the food was great. We went for lunch on a Friday and ordered off of their lunch menu (pick two). I ordered their mushroom, pepperoni, and sausage pizza with a spinach and quinoa salad. Both were exceptional. Our waitress Jessica was a pleasure as well.

The food we ordered was much better this time compared to the last time I went. Also our waiter was excellent and checked up on us several times. Our visit today was the best in terms of service and food. The reason for the 4 stars is due to the fact that the 3 hostess' at the end while we were leaving did not act as a hostess would. No goodbye or anything and they were too busy talking amongst themselves. Also I had made an error with my receipt and was explaining it to one of the ladies, but it didn't seem like she cared in all honesty. It may not seem like a big deal to others, but as someone who also works in the food service industry involving customer service, I think it was a bit unfortunate. Hoping next time will have better hosts and hostess' because they are the first and last impression a customer will have.

Me and my boyfriend came for lunch today and the customer service was great. We were seated promptly and the host was very kind. Our waiter checked on us a few times during our meal to make sure that we enjoyed everything! The food was prepared well (we got a mushroom and sausage pizza and Thai chicken salad). Overall great experience and I would recommend this California pizza kitchen over the one at the spectrum!

I give one star because it is required. My boyfriend went to lunch today and ordered the Salmon meal. At first it was served cold and raw in the middle. when he sent it back to be properly cooked, it came back burned and dry. He informed the server of that fact, she shrugged and said all the cooks they started with had left. Everyone in the kitchen were new and charged him for it anyway. Weather it costs $20.00 or $100.00, shouldn't it be properly prepared?  He trird not to make a big deal out of it as It's not the servers fault. The management and the kitchen need to be addresses. Too bad that their reputation means nothing to them..
First time here to new location in Irvine fun and hip atmosphere, food is great I must say the garlic bread and with olive oil is quite good. Glad I came here good for a late night dinner.

So noisy and so loud it was hard for the waiter to hear our orders.  Pizza was the worst ever.  The pineapple was crappy.  The waiter was excellent.  Never to return.  Also no parking at lunch time had to park far away.

Came here for dinner tonight with my 70 year old mom. Even at 5:30 on Friday night, we had a wait, so we sat at the bar and had a refreshing, albeit too sweet, mojito. We liked the decor--sort of a modern look with a late 1970's twist, lots of greens and woods--much better than the traditional yellow, black and white tiled CPK's of old. It's a little loud though, and my mom had a hard time hearing some conversation at times. After we were seated, our waiter, Max, suggested a Moscow Mule. My mom had never tried one, but she liked it a lot, especially on a hot evening (She wanted to buy the copper cup). We ordered an asparagus and arugula "small plate."  Could have used a dash of lemon juice or some contrasting note, but overall it was fresh, attractive, and tasty. We followed up with Kung Pao pasta and a pear and gorgonzola pizza. We split each and had plenty left to take home. The pasta could have used a bit of cilantro, but overall, this is quality food for the price.  I never understand why some Yelpers complain about CPK food being "prepackaged" or whatever, as if the only CPK food they ever ate was stuff they bought in the frozen food aisle at the supermarket. I first ate at a CPK in Newport Beach in 1989 and have always enjoyed their food. To be honest, this chain  just fell off my radar until 2 months ago when we ate at a "Next chapter" CPK in Scottsdale. This Alton/Irvine location is also a "next chapter," and I love the improvements in menu selection and decor. Our food server was attentive without being overbearing (in fact all of the staff was helpful and friendly), the ambiance was casual but hip, and we even got some live music drifting in from the patio dining area.  I see why this place is busy!

I've been here 3 times and each time the service has gotten worse and worse. The first time I tried CPK was on the grand opening night . We had 2 waiters yet it took 20 mins  for us to get water. We never got the bread that we asked for. I figured it was because it was the grand opening and they were really busy. The second time I came to CPK the wait was about 30mins even though they tell you it's about 15 mins. The tables are too close together that when the servers walked by they kept kicking my chair. Our server got my order wrong and when I let him know that wasn't what I ordered he insisted that I try the food. I let him know I didn't want the plate yet he continued to insist I try it. I was stuck with a plate that I didn't want. I ended up waiting an extra hour for the actual meal I ordered. I ordered an appetizer and never received it. I ended up taking my food to go because 2 hrs had passed and I hadn't eaten. The last time I went to CPK the hostess told us the wait was 25 mins I let her know I wanted a booth and she told me to let them know when I was about to be seated. Once the 30 mins passed I got called to be seated. I let the hostess know I had requested a booth seat and she told me I had to wait longer because none were available. I asked her if she could text me to notify me when the booth was ready and she agreed. After an hr wait I went inside to see if the booth was ready and the lady was like, "omg you still haven't been seated?" I let her know I didn't get a call and she said, " oh I didn't call your phone I called you outside." I let her know that she didn't call me and so she said oh I sent you a text. I took out my phone and told her that I didn't get a text so she claimed their messaging must've been down. It's sad the food is good but the service is terrible and I will not be returning here.

First time at this location. I love the new decor and pizza BUT the service here was really horrible. My husband accidentally spilled his drink and told one of the servers.  He definitely heard us but didn't return for a very long time with a towel. In the meantime my husband went to the bathroom to get some paper towels to clean up the mess!  I wanted to use my pizza dough offer and a free birthday dessert so before we ordered I asked if we can use both deals. Our server said we can.  At the end of the meal when our server comes with the bill be tells me that he wasn't able to use both offers and even the manager couldn't override it. Thanks for giving me false information!! It would have been nice to let me know before we ordered dessert. We also ordered the $.99 kids' sundae from the kids' menu but was charged $2.50 for it.  Wouldn't have noticed it if we didn't check each item on the bill.  The worst of all was we never got a refill of water!!! We had 10 thirsty people by the end of our meal. Great decor and food but needs improvement on service.

To Whom It May Concern: CPK 5465 Alton Pkwy Irvine CA. 92604 I wanted to express how IMPRESSED! I was when I parked at this establishment. I say park because literally the AMAZING experienced started there. The moment I parked my car at the curb side parking BOTH doors were opened for my entrance into picking up my order. This was SHOCKING to me. I have reviewed many establishments even those of 5 star standards and this has never happened to me.  Once I walked up to the doors I was greeted by both associates and was directed if it was a takeout or dinning in. They directed me to where I needed to go (without me having to ask!). Following this, the establishment was by far the best I have seen to date! Clean, cool, crisp, music was not too loud, I literally felt like I was a super star. I could not believe that there was a lobby just to wait for your food! When I was paying for my order the cashier referred to me as my name multiple times! I was just shocked that she went that far into her customer service. She not only did that she was very observant and saw I was wearing my work badge and commented on that and got to know me! She asked how long I been there and what I do. She was so skilled in this she didn't even hold up the line she was very swift made me feel important and not rushed. This is a very hard skill to master.  As far as the food! I been eating and writing this at the same time and I can barely concentrate. I have never had bake potato soup before and this is just so amazing I want to again and will be going for dinner! A date mind you to this specific location!  Once I paid and was leaving there were two people who walked up to give me ANOTHER double door exit I just couldn't believe my eyes. I appreciate GREAT customer service and let me tell you this was not that is was the BEST customer service I have ever experienced in the time I have been reviewing establishments or alive for that matter! This location seriously needs some type of recognition. I will do whatever it takes to make that happen! To let you know how serious I am (if you haven't gotten that already). I report bad customer service all the time. It take so much for me to want to give someone a great customer service rating. It takes even more for me to even want to call, let alone write a one page single spaced business letter to cooperate about this.  Please do something for this place as I feel it set a HUGE example for other establishments and praises the amazing staff that you have. Please contact me with any questions or follow up!

we have never had a bad experience at CPK their food is good prices are okay service is always great I wrote the review specifically for this place but it goes for all see it because around the country that I've ever eaten
i love this new location. Ive grown up with CPK and i love the new colors. the artichoke dip is amazing and bradley the bartender is really cool.

Definitely new and different atmosphere for California Pizza Kitchen, but not better. Seemed overly casual with too many tables crowded into the room. This location previously was El Cholo and you needed to be careful you weren't seated by the kitchen because of all the noise and commotion. The redesign has opened the kitchen area and now the noise and commotion is everywhere. The night we were there the music was cranked up apparently so it could be heard over the noise so everyone, including the poor servers, was forced to practically shout while speaking. It was a big disappointment as we had been looking forward to their opening for months. Haven't been back even though we live in the neighborhood and have always enjoyed the food at their other locations but do intend to stop by some evening to see if (hopefully) they have toned down the noise and confusion. If not, I'm gone.

Just opened and I've tested 3 salads and a few flat breads on multiple visits. Every half salad has been perfect. The service is professional and the water glasses are filled very often. I'm so glad to have CPK in the neighborhood.

Waited an hour and a half to be seated when they said it would only be 20 minutes. And then I had to go up and ask if the table was ready or else they would of never called me.  Last time I came the waiter got my order wrong, when he brought the wrong plate I told him it was wrong and I'll wait for the right food to come. And then he didnt want to take the food back and insisted I eat what he brought. The first time I came the waitress seemed very disinterested in her job and the food took more than 45 minutes to come. And every time it was made worse by the fact that none of the staff wanted to take responsibility for things going wrong.

Service was fine up until payment, we had a large group come in and I moved to a different table after receiving my food. Apparently a shift one table over is too difficult for the employees to take care of and they insisted that they had lost my money although I had paid already with a pretty generous tip. My friends at the table had all seen me put money in the check and even after this, the manager still demanded that I pay for my meal again.

Went to the new CPK In Irvine. The food was wonderful, the decor is clean and fresh and the service is great. The only problem is it's very loud inside. Bad acoustics. So loud in fact that we moved out to the patio so we could have a conversation.  Unfortunate the because as I said, the decor is lovely.

Love this place, great atmosphere but it's a pizza place, shame on me for ordering halibut. Anyway, came here for a drink and tried the halibut. Bad idea! First one came out over cooked. I was hungry and reluctant to say anything but Parker, the bar tend, great guy, insisted. 2nd one came out and had a seasoning on top that it hadn't had before, hmmm, masking? So the fish was cooked much better but still not as it should have been. Props to Parker and the manager (female, unknown name) for trying but lesson learned, don't get the halibut at this place! Nuff said
This place has the best Club pizza. Highly recommended.

New location is super close to my house, so I've been excited for it to open for a while of course. Came within first week of grand opening, which apparently was a horrible idea. Ordered the BBQ Chicken salad, but I'm vegan. So I said no chicken and cheese, extra black beans instead. Came out with cheese, and didn't notice because it was white and blended in with the jicama strands! Kinda gross considering I'm vegan. Then, to think it couldn't get worse/grosser... A HAIR!!! They spilled a water glass all over the table, kept forgetting things I asked for, too many servers just standing around doing nothing, and I just expected better for a chain like CPK. They put basil in the salad too... Supposed to be cilantro. Completely changes the whole taste of the salad (even though it's so minuscule it was everywhere and wrecked it!!) They did comp the meal, but I was expecting my mom's salad to also get comped. It's the least they could do...
Bartender texting while on duty. Forgot drink order. Not good, place us usually better. Food is good though.

So I've been here a few times and the service was so terrible that we ended in walking out because nobody would come take our order. However, Our waitress today totally redeemed the reputation of this restaurant. Paige was so friendly and always made sure everything was alright! She is definitely one of the best servers this restaurant has to offer. Keep up the great work, Paige! I hope your finger gets better soon!

Obviously I know they just opened so this is a preliminary review... way too many people at the front door, very uncomfortable. Not much of a waiting area. There are two tables right inside between the bathroom, waiting area, and kitchen... i specifically told my family "I'd be so pissed if i had to sit there..". ... guess where we sat?? So we had people walking around us the whole time. Server was understandably uneasy, but tried and did a decent job. My kids got their drinks and food pretty quickly after ordering and were happy. Our drinks took a while, as did our food. I ordered the cedar plank salmon with seasonal veggies instead of spinach- $2 extra and very overcooked, couldn't eat it. My husband got the spicy chipotle chicken pizza... VERY, very spicy. I thought he was exaggerating but i (who enjoys spicy food) had a hard time eating it. Lots of managers, cooks, and general staff walking around. I hope they work out the kinks quickly!!
First time here and  I gotta say everyone here is very friendly. My server Justin is very attentive. Overall, the food is good but my monitor taste excellent!

I've been to the other branches of CPK, but this branch in Irvine Alton Pkwy is by far the best!!!! Huge shout out to Alex for an awesome job! We threw a surprise birthday celebration for my daughter today and the entire staff made sure that it was special one. From our greeter to our table and by accommodating our icecream birthday cake. They even put it in their refrigerator to make sure its not melted by the time for cake blowing. I super loved the thai salad and the sicilian pizza! By the time i was going to try the fettucino alfredo, it was all gone! So i know, this was a hit with the girls. On top of the fantastic food, their customer service was excellent, excellent, excellent! Specially, when the whole entire staff took the time to sign a unexpected birthday greeting card for the birthday girl! In my opinion, this deserves 10 stars for them making the birthday girl feel super special!!!!

Went here for a late lunch on Labor Day. The wait wasn't too bad - about 15 minutes. Service was good and the food was good. The problem was the noise level. Way. Too. Noisy. I guess it is because of the open floor plan, the sounds bounce off of the walls and make it nearly impossible to carry on a conversation with the person directly across from you. There was only two of us there that day and we ate quickly and got out. We aren't planning on returning any time soon unless we bring earplugs.

Really dissatisfied here. From the very start, I walked into the restaurant and approached the front desk. I told  one of the three individuals standing there that we were a family if five, when I was snapped at, "You need to talk to him!"  I was directed to someone standing OUTSIDE. I checked in with Luis, who was nice. We were told it would be a 15 minute wait to seat on the empty patio.  We were seated away from the single heater, and the staff member seemed confused that we would want to be closer to it. Eventually, Michael our server came to take our orders. He messes up the appetizer order, bringing guac not hummus, which came out late. He didn't bring napkins, silverware or sugar for the ice tea, any of the three or four times he came to the table. I asked him how big the flat bread was, and he outlined something that was literally TWICE the size of what eventually came out. When the food did arrive, the pasta was really undercooked, the two children's pizzas were the WRONG orders and as I mentioned previously, the flat bread was tiny. We sent the children's pizzas back, and they came back with pepperoni just tossed on top.  I am super disappointed with the service, the food wasn't up to CPK standards and we will never, ever return. If you like undercooked food and the wrong order, served with attitude, then this is your place.
Such great service by Starvin Marvin! Great food choices and the dessert menu looks amazing!!

Good food. Same as to be expected from CPK. New, so clean inside and their new theme is much better than the previous stale, cold theme. However, during my 3 visits, the staff and been consistently clueless when it comes to alcoholic drinks. They have no ideas of what beers are on tap or the difference between wines. The menu says " ask about our local beer selections", so I did. The server started with Corona and attempted to tell me all the typical commercial brands before pointing to the list I was holding and said there were too many to remember. I ended up with a Sam Adams.
